commit_message:
Add octane/bin directory to manifest file

The directory octane/bin contains non-python scripts and
binaries that octane uses to perform certain tasks locally
and on remote nodes.

Change-Id: I867f88de636a7fe666cdb537b70f18f05e332508
Closes-bug: 1584638

commit_message:
Update Kuryr deliverable

This adds two new deliverable to Kuryr, libnetwork driver
and Kubernetes integration.
This is done in order to simplify deployment and
packaging of different parts of Kuryr.

Change-Id: I5a76d6c797883f4f1dfe9c3efba42116afac97fb

commit_message:
Allow QuiteLogger to hide custom log level

By default we want to hide all messages except errors but in several cases
(like assert_ha_services_ready) we need to suppress error messages too.

Change-Id: I513c73055f0e517b308868b1cd500a185ea81be2

commit_message:
add support for additional js files

Extensions can bring forward js files. This ensures that we actually
add those js files into the rendered output. Needed by the new work on
the API site.

Change-Id: I77b2d3556498d9a463deb601301cb3395991d784

profile for debian-installer, since it's no longer
used [1]

Related-Bug: #1549346
Related-Bug: #1570267
Change-Id: I5262bbd726112e1a32513d71ac04b1fb6767983f
"}]
commit_message:
Remove deprecated cobbler parts for classic provisioning

Since Fuel 6.1 we no longer support CentOS envs,
so let's remove related cobbler config entries,
snippets etc.
In Fuel 7.0 we dropped classic provisioning mode,
fully switching to IBP. Remove cobbler distro and
profile for debian-installer, since it's no longer
used [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/299340/

Related-Bug: #1549346
Related-Bug: #1570267

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-23 04:43:33.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': 'Enforce UUID of port/subnet ID for router interfaces

The add_router_interface/remove_router_interface actions
are not subject to the typical attribute map validation
so the input values for port_id and subnet_id were not
being checked for UUID likeness. This lead to an ugly
traceback if a boolean value was present which could
fill logs with garbage if a tenant kept doing it.

This patch calls the API validator for UUIDs in the
_validate_interface_info function where we validate requests
to add_router_inferface and remove_router_interface.

Change-Id: I0a0d3279a21c815fb78528860fc2a35c1d5a4e2d
Closes-Bug: #1584510
'}]
commit_message:
Enforce UUID of port/subnet ID for router interfaces

The add_router_interface/remove_router_interface actions
are not subject to the typical attribute map validation
so the input values for port_id and subnet_id were not
being checked for UUID likeness. This lead to an ugly
traceback if a boolean value was present which could
fill logs with garbage if a tenant kept doing it.

This patch calls the API validator for UUIDs in the
_validate_interface_info function where we validate requests
to add_router_inferface and remove_router_interface.

Change-Id: I0a0d3279a21c815fb78528860fc2a35c1d5a4e2d
Closes-Bug: #1584510

commit_message:
Tests: Don't attempt connection for Coho driver init

This test is unreliable because it tries to actually
connect to the network, and test for failure.

Rather than trying to actually make a connection,
just throw an error.

Change-Id: I896979516f4fc751a30998120f510c3a4e5f59f6
Closes-Bug: #1582370

subject: Add developer mode
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-29 23:29:12.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/common/defaults/main.yml', 'configs/dev.yml', 'playbooks/roles/tripleo/overcloud/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/tripleo/undercloud/templates/undercloud-install.sh.j2', 'quickstart.sh'], 'message': 'Add developer mode

There are two fundamental use cases for tripleo-quickstart.
One is the new TripleO user use case. The defaults of
tripleo-quickstart are meant to address this use case and
provide a good first experience of TripleO for anyone trying
it out.

The other is for developers to be able to replicate CI results
in their local environment. These use cases conflict in that
replicating CI does not provide as much stability for new users.

This change addresses that conflict by creating a developer mode.
To begin with, the only thing this mode does is use puppet modules
from source.

  - on the undercloud via env variables passed to the undercloud
    install

  - on the overcloud via the deploy artifacts mechanism in
    tripleo-heat-templates

In the future, it would be good to also support passing in arbitrary
extra repos which would be placed on both the undercloud and overcloud
images.

Change-Id: I9847bc31bbc16fba3af5e1053b55e49e2de4838c
Partial-Bug: 1572958
'}]
commit_message:
Add developer mode

There are two fundamental use cases for tripleo-quickstart.
One is the new TripleO user use case. The defaults of
tripleo-quickstart are meant to address this use case and
provide a good first experience of TripleO for anyone trying
it out.

The other is for developers to be able to replicate CI results
in their local environment. These use cases conflict in that
replicating CI does not provide as much stability for new users.

This change addresses that conflict by creating a developer mode.
To begin with, the only thing this mode does is use puppet modules
from source.

  - on the undercloud via env variables passed to the undercloud
    install

  - on the overcloud via the deploy artifacts mechanism in
    tripleo-heat-templates

In the future, it would be good to also support passing in arbitrary
extra repos which would be placed on both the undercloud and overcloud
images.

Change-Id: I9847bc31bbc16fba3af5e1053b55e49e2de4838c
Partial-Bug: 1572958

[{'number': 24, 'created': '2016-05-18 11:08:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/migrate_data.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_migrate_data.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Add serial ports to the migration data object

The serial console code in nova picks TCP ports for each serial
interface of an instance. When doing a live migration, the
TCP ports used for the migrating instance might be in use on
the target hypervisor which causes the live migration to fail.

This patch adds a field to the migration data object so that a follow
up patch can use that to rewrite the guest XML.

Change-Id: I970014ee0ee8059f5976797bf344fea9a7ccb32d
Related-Bug: #1455252
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Add serial ports to the migration data object

The serial console code in nova picks TCP ports for each serial
interface of an instance. When doing a live migration, the
TCP ports used for the migrating instance might be in use on
the target hypervisor which causes the live migration to fail.

This patch adds a field to the migration data object so that a follow
up patch can use that to rewrite the guest XML.

Change-Id: I970014ee0ee8059f5976797bf344fea9a7ccb32d
Related-Bug: #1455252

commit_message:
Spec for the vendordata reboot.

As discussed at the Newton summit, we don't love having pluggable
modules for vendordata, but we would be willing to have an
external REST service which provides metadata. This spec explores
what an implementation of that could look like.

Blueprint: vendordata-reboot
Change-Id: Ibd5714be954838dbf8636e6988cb91d50f5c3baf

commit_message:
Redirect to https for horizon

This adds a TLS binding listening on the internal network for
horizon. And on the other hand, if the public binding for horizon is
accessed via non-https, it will redirect to https.

Change-Id: I1f92ecd0c4845450df4b24f6b621d313ba9cbfc4
Closes-Bug: #1583643
(cherry picked from commit f8de51a85da685f92900ea17aef8b16a32661843)

commit_message:
Remove k8s APIs pod, rcs, svc and container API

Magnum supports multiple COEs however it contains APIs that only work
with certain COEs. To create a coherent service we will only support
APIs that work across all bay types. We will allow API extensions to bay
drivers to allow Magnum to manage containers, but we are not attempting
to create a unified abstraction for containers across COEs.

A follow up patch will continue this refactor by removing the objects
for the k8s specific objects and the CLI commands from
python-magnumclient.

Implements: blueprint delete-container-endpoint
Change-Id: I1f6f04a35dfbb39f217487fea104ded035b75569

commit_message:

subject: Use JUJU_MODEL_UUID for Juju 2.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-23 09:10:58.000000000', 'files': ['lib/swift_context.py', 'unit_tests/test_swift_context.py'], 'message': 'Use JUJU_MODEL_UUID for Juju 2.0

Juju 2.0 renames the environment variable JUJU_ENV_UUID
to JUJU_MODEL_UUID; use this environment variable as a
fallback if JUJU_ENV_UUID is not set to support Juju 2.0,
whilst continuing to provide support for Juju < 2.0.

Change-Id: I26ae366c84d3cd9a9c2471385effd2a6202e9314
Closes-Bug: 1572575
'}]
commit_message:
Use JUJU_MODEL_UUID for Juju 2.0

Juju 2.0 renames the environment variable JUJU_ENV_UUID
to JUJU_MODEL_UUID; use this environment variable as a
fallback if JUJU_ENV_UUID is not set to support Juju 2.0,
whilst continuing to provide support for Juju < 2.0.

Change-Id: I26ae366c84d3cd9a9c2471385effd2a6202e9314
Closes-Bug: 1572575

commit_message:
be more explicit that rate limits are gone in v2.1

The rate limit code was trivially wrong the moment you had > 1 API
server, so we deprecated it with the legacy v2 code. The key still
exists in v2.1 but it's always empty. It's just confusing that it
looks like it's still getting data from the environment, which it is
not.

Clear this up and leave some comments so we can further eliminate
things after the v2 legacy drop.

Because there is a difference between v2 legacy and v2.1, delete all
the v2 legacy tests. This included a ton of direct testing of the
Ratelimit middleware that is about to be removed (as it only exists
for the v2 legacy stack).

Change-Id: Icfd77aecf77ad626c0efb93f59a6db11f21b3d56

commit_message:
Add "disable local disks" option to flavors

This feature adds the possibility to define a flavor,
that does not create any ephemeral disks locally on the hypervisor.
If the new flavor key 'local_disks' is set to 'False', users are
"forced" to create a bootable volume to launch an instance from
that flavor.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I52b8d473d86ce471e61a2c3505f6c274ad0643b8
Implements: blueprint flavor-root-disk-none

In mitaka-template.rst file, there is a link which forwards to
a slightly deprecated site about blueprints and specs.

In the current template [1] under
"Some notes about the nova-spec and blueprint process:"

there are several points, the first one is:
 * Not all blueprints need a spec. For more information see
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/devref/kilo.blueprints.html#when-is-a-blueprint-needed

commit_message:
Blueprints and specs link has been replaced

In mitaka-template.rst file, there is a link which forwards to
a slightly deprecated site about blueprints and specs.

In the current template [1] under
"Some notes about the nova-spec and blueprint process:"

there are several points, the first one is:
 * Not all blueprints need a spec. For more information see
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/devref/kilo.blueprints.html#when-is-a-blueprint-needed

This link refers to documentation of Kilo release, and
there is information about Juno and Kilo release, which may be misleading.

This link is being replaced with [2] which is
the current version of the blueprint document.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova-specs/blob/master/specs/mitaka-template.rst
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/blueprints.html

Change-Id: I2a178966b65f628d5752c5327aeda8b625f190ba
Closes-Bug: #1582783

subject: Constraint tox targets with upper-constraints.txt
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-23 09:59:14.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Constraint tox targets with upper-constraints.txt

Client version pin is maintained in upper-constraints.txt file, so we
should replace it in the file with source based specifier before
applying it to pip install, otherwise pip fails with:

Could not satisfy constraints for 'python-neutronclient': installation
from path or url cannot be constrained to a version

Conflicts:
	tox.ini

Liberty changes:
- no change for releasenotes tox target due to it's missing in the
  branch.

Also switched to using stable/liberty branch instead of master.

Change-Id: I33302cdcab980a42c39dc9ec1e430add459615ff
Closes-Bug: #1583050
(cherry picked from commit 78d778cdeccb6a24b7f6fa7e3c2eb0891b633701)
"}]
commit_message:
Constraint tox targets with upper-constraints.txt

Client version pin is maintained in upper-constraints.txt file, so we
should replace it in the file with source based specifier before
applying it to pip install, otherwise pip fails with:

Could not satisfy constraints for 'python-neutronclient': installation
from path or url cannot be constrained to a version

Conflicts:
	tox.ini

Liberty changes:
- no change for releasenotes tox target due to it's missing in the
  branch.

Also switched to using stable/liberty branch instead of master.

Change-Id: I33302cdcab980a42c39dc9ec1e430add459615ff
Closes-Bug: #1583050
(cherry picked from commit 78d778cdeccb6a24b7f6fa7e3c2eb0891b633701)

commit_message:
Constraint tox targets with upper-constraints.txt

Client version pin is maintained in upper-constraints.txt file, so we
should replace it in the file with source based specifier before
applying it to pip install, otherwise pip fails with:

Could not satisfy constraints for 'python-neutronclient': installation
from path or url cannot be constrained to a version

Also switched to using stable/mitaka branch instead of master.

Change-Id: I33302cdcab980a42c39dc9ec1e430add459615ff
Closes-Bug: #1583050
(cherry picked from commit 78d778cdeccb6a24b7f6fa7e3c2eb0891b633701)

commit_message:
Subgraph matching to return the found matching vertices, and not only their ids.
This information is use full later in the evaluator, instead of querying the graph again.

Change-Id: Ibe466e9ab7a9d99e4fd531c6eabac3c343b8616d

commit_message:
Move script host_evacuation.sh to helpers/ directory

Currently the only file in bin/ directory is the host_evacuation
script. It is not installed as a part of RPM package. Move the
file to path that is included in RPM package and already contains
scripts to be executed at remote nodes, e.g. delete_fuel_resourses.py.

Change-Id: Ic337fb23719da5432fc5c9cc95b82d133ebd3aff
Closes-bug: 1584638

commit_message:
Versioned notification transformation

In Mitaka the basic infrastructure for the versioned notification has been
merged. Now it is time to start transforming our existing legacy
notifications to the new format. This spec proposes the first couple of
transformations.

Implements: blueprint versioned-notification-transformation-newton
Change-Id: I71a57678245b8da1cfca48c944fab06a03f58da9

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-29 09:58:30.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/models/environment.py'], 'message': 'Update MU application procedure

The procedure were updated, see
https://docs.fuel-infra.org/openstack/fuel/fuel-6.1/maintenance-updates.html#mos61-how-to-update
https://docs.fuel-infra.org/openstack/fuel/fuel-7.0/maintenance-updates.html#mos70mu-how-to-update

commit_message:
Update MU application procedure

The procedure were updated, see
https://docs.fuel-infra.org/openstack/fuel/fuel-6.1/maintenance-updates.html#mos61-how-to-update
https://docs.fuel-infra.org/openstack/fuel/fuel-7.0/maintenance-updates.html#mos70mu-how-to-update

After discovering https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1555262
there is no possible to apply MU using bootstrap_admin_node.sh after
nailgun password changing. We should follow the new doc.

commit_message:
Stop setting up pki for keystone

PKI tokens in keystone are being deprecated in the upstream puppet
module as part of Change I6c481abce0b917a5d16e207b51b15337f150c908.
Additionally PKI tokens are not recommanded for production use and we
use fernet tokens in Fuel. As such this change removed the pki setup as
part of the default keystone installation.

DocImpact: PKI tokens setup no longer triggered as part of the default
keystone installation.

Change-Id: I931ab8e4d073fd3961e339e629377d756bdbbfb1
Closes-Bug: #1583557

commit_message:
Allow the mirror server to be publicly accessible

Developers, community members and CI jobs would like to be able to
download images that are known to have passed tripleo-ci. To make
them available we allow httpd to listen to all IP's and restrict
the upload script to only accept files from the test network.

Change-Id: I8708fd8ef069283093b7c070e86892f5abce1cb1

Previously fuelmenu took first network interface
(if it's not specified by user) as default option
for admin NIC whether it has IP address or not.
Now it tries to find a NIC with IP assigned, so

Related-bug: #1566557

commit_message:
Use first NIC with IP address by default

Previously fuelmenu took first network interface
(if it's not specified by user) as default option
for admin NIC whether it has IP address or not.
Now it tries to find a NIC with IP assigned, so
it works fine without additional options when
admin network is attached to not first interface.

Change-Id: Iabd0ebb81af40b4f97f67df92403fcff7c268edf
Related-bug: #1566557

subject: Fix libvirtd_opts when using systemd
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7732, 'name': 'IvanBerezovskiy', 'email': 'ivan.berezovskii@gmail.com', 'username': 'iberezovskiy'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 7979, 'name': 'Mikhail S Medvedev', 'email': 'mihailmed@gmail.com', 'username': 'msmedved'}, {'_account_id': 8175, 'name': 'Rafael Folco', 'email': 'rfolco@redhat.com', 'username': 'rfolco'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 15519, 'name': 'Iury Gregory Melo Ferreira', 'display_name': 'Iury Gregory', 'email': 'iurygregory@gmail.com', 'username': 'iurygregory'}, {'_account_id': 18242, 'name': 'Mark Hamzy', 'email': 'hamzy@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'hamzy'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-05-19 20:18:53.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/nova_compute_libvirt_spec.rb', 'manifests/migration/libvirt.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_migration_libvirt_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Fix libvirtd_opts when using systemd

You see the following error when using puppet:
Error: Could not start Service[libvirt]: Execution of '/bin/systemctl
start libvirt-bin' returned 1: Job for libvirt-bin.service failed
because the control process exited with error code. See "systemctl
status libvirt-bin.service" and "journalctl -xe" for details.

This is because you cannot start the libvirt-bin service twice in a row.

root@pkvmci829:~# systemctl start libvirt-bin
root@pkvmci829:~# systemctl start libvirt-bin
Job for libvirt-bin.service failed because the control process exited
with error code. See "systemctl status libvirt-bin.service" and
"journalctl -xe" for details.

Systemd already is able to start libvirtd as a daemon.  It does not need
the -d parameter added to /etc/default/libvirt-bin.  This just causes
systemd to keep respawning libvirtd in a loop until it realizes that it
isn't working.

Change-Id: Iaffe85dda5c5bfed88f27602189aca074ec7aeda
'}]
commit_message:
Fix libvirtd_opts when using systemd

You see the following error when using puppet:
Error: Could not start Service[libvirt]: Execution of '/bin/systemctl
start libvirt-bin' returned 1: Job for libvirt-bin.service failed
because the control process exited with error code. See "systemctl
status libvirt-bin.service" and "journalctl -xe" for details.

This is because you cannot start the libvirt-bin service twice in a row.

root@pkvmci829:~# systemctl start libvirt-bin
root@pkvmci829:~# systemctl start libvirt-bin
Job for libvirt-bin.service failed because the control process exited
with error code. See "systemctl status libvirt-bin.service" and
"journalctl -xe" for details.

Systemd already is able to start libvirtd as a daemon.  It does not need
the -d parameter added to /etc/default/libvirt-bin.  This just causes
systemd to keep respawning libvirtd in a loop until it realizes that it
isn't working.

Change-Id: Iaffe85dda5c5bfed88f27602189aca074ec7aeda

python-smaugclient 0.0.4 makes some changes like below:
* Fix creating scheduled_operations error.
* Add a field "parameters" to resource plan.
* Remove the "project_id" in the url of smaugclient resource.
The way of smaugclient initialization is changed.
So it is important to bump smaugclient to version 0.0.4.

Change-Id: Iaf9147b93331287a0f37b41cb5c0db3ce30fedd3
'}]
commit_message:
Bump python-smaugclient to 0.0.4

python-smaugclient 0.0.4 makes some changes like below:
* Fix creating scheduled_operations error.
* Add a field "parameters" to resource plan.
* Remove the "project_id" in the url of smaugclient resource.
The way of smaugclient initialization is changed.
So it is important to bump smaugclient to version 0.0.4.

Change-Id: Iaf9147b93331287a0f37b41cb5c0db3ce30fedd3

commit_message:
Install murano-agent to pip default location

During package build murano-agent was installed into /opt/stack/<smthg>
directory. This causes problems with the new way of how agent is
detected by murano.
Related-Bug: #1570962
Change-Id: I3dbacb03243d462e9f688e502deec07e33490b30

subject: Fix workaround to not install packages during dlrn build
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-20 20:03:42.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo.sh'], 'message': 'Fix workaround to not install packages during dlrn build

Our workaround for this has been broken for quite a long time [1].

I only noticed when trying to build a package that was failing to
install. Removing the --postinstall option to mock has the same
effect.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-packages/DLRN/commit/1e56c1131458890089e9c924c2d87dc19dda1bc2

Change-Id: Ibedea587a2ab709d1c3a9094f20240711545e9d4

commit_message:
Fix workaround to not install packages during dlrn build

Our workaround for this has been broken for quite a long time [1].

I only noticed when trying to build a package that was failing to
install. Removing the --postinstall option to mock has the same
effect.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-packages/DLRN/commit/1e56c1131458890089e9c924c2d87dc19dda1bc2

Change-Id: Ibedea587a2ab709d1c3a9094f20240711545e9d4

subject: Fix build for oraclelinux base
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-05-16 09:18:32.000000000', 'files': ['docker/base/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': "Fix build for oraclelinux base

centos-release-openstack-mitaka 1.3 is now available via the
delorean-mitaka-testing repo. We need to install this directly instead
of the 1.2 version as otherwise the subsequent 'yum update' tries to
install it and fails on the centos-release dependency which is
incompatible with the oraclelinux base.

Closes-Bug: 1576238

Change-Id: I51cb372424b27b32e95f9e81c5dddbe8e49a6131
"}]
commit_message:
Fix build for oraclelinux base

centos-release-openstack-mitaka 1.3 is now available via the
delorean-mitaka-testing repo. We need to install this directly instead
of the 1.2 version as otherwise the subsequent 'yum update' tries to
install it and fails on the centos-release dependency which is
incompatible with the oraclelinux base.

Closes-Bug: 1576238

Change-Id: I51cb372424b27b32e95f9e81c5dddbe8e49a6131

subject: Don't use stored context to reset stacks
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-18 14:59:33.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_engine_service.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': "Don't use stored context to reset stacks

The resetting of in-progress stacks at startup is done using an admin
context. No user actions (e.g. ReST API calls) are performed, so there is
no need to load the user context that is stored with the stack. (Nor is the
current context rewritten to the database in the process of resetting the
state.)

Since loading the user context from the DB may result in a call to the
keystone API, eliminating this ensures that stacks can be reset
successfully even if heat-engine starts before keystone is available.

Change-Id: I8109c622b7661254a658d78d98f8dc8f756d8755
Closes-Bug: #1570569
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use stored context to reset stacks

The resetting of in-progress stacks at startup is done using an admin
context. No user actions (e.g. ReST API calls) are performed, so there is
no need to load the user context that is stored with the stack. (Nor is the
current context rewritten to the database in the process of resetting the
state.)

Since loading the user context from the DB may result in a call to the
keystone API, eliminating this ensures that stacks can be reset
successfully even if heat-engine starts before keystone is available.

Change-Id: I8109c622b7661254a658d78d98f8dc8f756d8755
Closes-Bug: #1570569

commit_message:
Cache node object inside hw manager instances

This patch is adding a new method to the base HardwareManager class
called "cache_node_object", the idea of this method is to tell the
instances to cache the representation of a node inside it so methods of
the hardware manager can easily get access to it.

If not in standalone mode, all the hardware manager instances will
contain a self.node attribute loaded with the node representation found
by the lookup() mechanism.

Change-Id: I246d0942002165c8f0dda9123a258a910d23adcb

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-05-18 15:23:47.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/hardware.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_hardware.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'ironic_python_agent/utils.py'], 'message': "Get root device hints from the node object

In order to support a more complex syntax for root device hints (e.g
operators: greater than, less than, in, etc...) we need to stop relying
on the kernel command line for passing the root device hints. Since the
hardware managers already have a representation of the ironic node's
object we should use it and get the root device hints directly from its
properties.

For context, the kernel command line was used in the past because of the
old bash ramdisk. Since we used the same [i]PXE template for both ramdisks
we needed a generic way to pass the hints for both deploy ramdisks.

Partial-Bug: #1561137
Change-Id: If3a44cb813b565ea47dea310f59f28479fc326f4
"}]
commit_message:
Get root device hints from the node object

In order to support a more complex syntax for root device hints (e.g
operators: greater than, less than, in, etc...) we need to stop relying
on the kernel command line for passing the root device hints. Since the
hardware managers already have a representation of the ironic node's
object we should use it and get the root device hints directly from its
properties.

For context, the kernel command line was used in the past because of the
old bash ramdisk. Since we used the same [i]PXE template for both ramdisks
we needed a generic way to pass the hints for both deploy ramdisks.

Partial-Bug: #1561137
Change-Id: If3a44cb813b565ea47dea310f59f28479fc326f4

subject: Makes config() function be available to Core Library only
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-05 16:36:30.000000000', 'files': ['murano/common/engine.py', 'murano/engine/system/yaql_functions.py'], 'message': 'Makes config() function be available to Core Library only

config() function returns information from murano.conf.
But since it contains sensitive information like passwords
it creates a security issue for Murano because any app can
get access to that information. However the function is
used by the core library to get RabbitMQ credentials.

This commit makes the function available to Core Library
only which currently identified by the name (io.murano)
but in the future will be identified by the package signature.

Change-Id: I3fe5c153f931decc59bc8bf9eb87c78d459a64fa
Closes-Bug: #1506807
(cherry picked from commit dafd569775d02fcd827045ca7cbdbc7ead613233)
'}]
commit_message:
Makes config() function be available to Core Library only

config() function returns information from murano.conf.
But since it contains sensitive information like passwords
it creates a security issue for Murano because any app can
get access to that information. However the function is
used by the core library to get RabbitMQ credentials.

This commit makes the function available to Core Library
only which currently identified by the name (io.murano)
but in the future will be identified by the package signature.

Change-Id: I3fe5c153f931decc59bc8bf9eb87c78d459a64fa
Closes-Bug: #1506807
(cherry picked from commit dafd569775d02fcd827045ca7cbdbc7ead613233)

commit_message:
[WIP] Allow 'baremetal import' command to also start introspection

One more command less to type:
    openstack baremetal import --introspect instackenv.json
will now do the introspection for all new and updated nodes.

The introspection code was refactored to utils.introspect_nodes with only small
changes (removes excessive logging and sleeping between introspections).

Change-Id: I6454c9d9a0d00f16acbdb94b7ec694811c3718a7

commit_message:
Fixes resource filter to handle physical_resource_id properly

The usage of resource.nova_instance property name is removed
and resource.physical_resource_id is used instead, except in
db schema. This patch takes care of this case, for the bug
fix made for resource filtering earlier.

Closes-bug: #1568974

commit_message:
Add support for dry-run deployment without actual graph execution

This patch allows for astute to receive 'dry_run' option in deployment
message and skip actual graph execution. This makes it easier for Fuel
users to execut particular deployment and see the resulting expanded
deployment graph.

Change-Id: I28f216522fbeba9663d836b3d5a2f64c51133238
Partial-bug: #1569839

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-23 10:30:23.000000000', 'files': ['doc/base_tests.rst', 'fuelweb_test/tests/test_states_unlock_settings_tab.py'], 'message': 'Tests for unlock settings tab from different cluster states

Add tests for Unlock Settings Tab Feature for
partially deployed cluster and for failed
deployment.

Check unlock settings tab after partially deploy
  Scenario:
    1. Revert snapshot ready_with_3_slaves
    2. Create a new env
    3. Add controller and 2 computes
    4. Provision nodes without deploy
    5. Select some nodes (not all) and deploy them
    6. Download current settings and modify some of them
    7. Upload changed settings
    8. Re-deploy cluster
    9. Run OSTF
    10. Make snapshot
  Duration 90m
  Snapshot partially_deployed_unlock

Check unlock settings tab after failed deploy
  Scenario:
    1. Revert snapshot ready_with_3_slaves
    2. Create a new env
    3. Add controller and 2 computes
    4. Change netconfig task to fail deploy
    5. Deploy the env
    6. Download current settings and modify some of them
    7. Upload changed settings
    8. Change netconfig task to normal state
    9. Re-deploy cluster
    10. Run OSTF
    11. Make snapshot

  Duration 60m
  Snapshot failed_deploy_unlock

Change-Id: I84759ae0a603c4749dce2ac9b36c3a3c822514ee
(cherry picked from commit 399114cc560911f0bdc24a4e585e2b920a190b18)
'}]
commit_message:
Tests for unlock settings tab from different cluster states

Add tests for Unlock Settings Tab Feature for
partially deployed cluster and for failed
deployment.

Check unlock settings tab after partially deploy
  Scenario:
    1. Revert snapshot ready_with_3_slaves
    2. Create a new env
    3. Add controller and 2 computes
    4. Provision nodes without deploy
    5. Select some nodes (not all) and deploy them
    6. Download current settings and modify some of them
    7. Upload changed settings
    8. Re-deploy cluster
    9. Run OSTF
    10. Make snapshot
  Duration 90m
  Snapshot partially_deployed_unlock

Check unlock settings tab after failed deploy
  Scenario:
    1. Revert snapshot ready_with_3_slaves
    2. Create a new env
    3. Add controller and 2 computes
    4. Change netconfig task to fail deploy
    5. Deploy the env
    6. Download current settings and modify some of them
    7. Upload changed settings
    8. Change netconfig task to normal state
    9. Re-deploy cluster
    10. Run OSTF
    11. Make snapshot

  Duration 60m
  Snapshot failed_deploy_unlock

Change-Id: I84759ae0a603c4749dce2ac9b36c3a3c822514ee
(cherry picked from commit 399114cc560911f0bdc24a4e585e2b920a190b18)

commit_message:
Fix test error caused by i18n

Now oslo i18n _() returns a Message object which doesn't support
addition, so put all the texts in _() to avoid error.

subject: Switch npm-lint to non-voting for fuel-ui
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-20 13:12:40.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Switch npm-lint to non-voting for fuel-ui

This job is barely functional about a week due to some issues:

* "Module not found" issue after switch to NPM 3.5.2. More info
  at https://github.com/npm/npm/issues/12196
* Random ECONNREFUSED when downloading modules
* Issues with a mirror which was set up to resolve the previous
  issue - the responses sometimes are cut.

So this job should be switched to non-voting until all the issues
are resolved.

Change-Id: I13834d4435925fb31b45ce5690ed2717e368186b
'}]
commit_message:
Switch npm-lint to non-voting for fuel-ui

This job is barely functional about a week due to some issues:

* "Module not found" issue after switch to NPM 3.5.2. More info
  at https://github.com/npm/npm/issues/12196
* Random ECONNREFUSED when downloading modules
* Issues with a mirror which was set up to resolve the previous
  issue - the responses sometimes are cut.

So this job should be switched to non-voting until all the issues
are resolved.

Change-Id: I13834d4435925fb31b45ce5690ed2717e368186b

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/commmon in flake8 exclude list

The directory openstack/common was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have graduated some separated libraries.
Don't use the directory any more.

Change-Id: I7bfb899f8b94e4dc19fd4cef43466a5baac3a3ec

commit_message:
Cinder volume type access tests

Added:
- Api for type_access_add
- Api for type_access_remove
- Api for type_access_list

Tests:
- Adding volume type access for a given project
- List volume type access

Change-Id: Ic4b05a7fc1053a6af259f55a063a82df9ad1c073
Note: Cinder V1 does not support volume type access actions

commit_message:
Enable RabbitMQ heartbeats by default

Use defaults for heartbeat_timeout_threshold and
heartbeat_rate parameters for all openstack services
except Neutron: heartbeats don't properly work for it.

Change-Id: I72b2d76f56516e69532549bf6c2c6c468ff47089
Closes-bug: #1584004

commit_message:
Create 'clustercheck' user only on primary controller.

It's not necessary to do it on all controllers. Part with
creating user in db was excluded from status.pp and it's
called separately on primary controller.

Change-Id: I9eb66b64bcae8077e2a7812ec769ddcadf470719
Closes-Bug: #1580243

commit_message:
Fix encoding errors while working with APIs

Use 'requests' module for HTTP requests to TestRail
and Jenkins API instead of 'urllib'. It provides a
method which decode response data using proper
character encoding (charset from headers) and returns
unicode string.

Also add one more environment variable to settings,
because it's needed by proboscis for test plan
generation (since I9b9d40a59d24f579502a38dfc9b8c142bc219a06
was merged).

Closes-bug: #1584401
Change-Id: I3d6cde2c8066bd58e735142fe26d56e83d1c90de
(cherry picked from commit 5072b8426c380a6b3bf6d81c958c7b0bfe3483da)

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-23 09:58:24.000000000', 'files': ['doc/base_tests.rst', 'fuelweb_test/tests/test_states_unlock_settings_tab.py'], 'message': 'Tests for unlock settings tab from different cluster states

Add tests for Unlock Settings Tab Feature for
partially deployed cluster and for failed
deployment.

Check unlock settings tab after partially deploy
  Scenario:
    1. Revert snapshot ready_with_3_slaves
    2. Create a new env
    3. Add controller and 2 computes
    4. Provision nodes without deploy
    5. Select some nodes (not all) and deploy them
    6. Download current settings and modify some of them
    7. Upload changed settings
    8. Re-deploy cluster
    9. Run OSTF
    10. Make snapshot
  Duration 90m
  Snapshot partially_deployed_unlock

Check unlock settings tab after failed deploy
  Scenario:
    1. Revert snapshot ready_with_3_slaves
    2. Create a new env
    3. Add controller and 2 computes
    4. Change netconfig task to fail deploy
    5. Deploy the env
    6. Download current settings and modify some of them
    7. Upload changed settings
    8. Change netconfig task to normal state
    9. Re-deploy cluster
    10. Run OSTF
    11. Make snapshot

  Duration 60m
  Snapshot failed_deploy_unlock

Change-Id: I84759ae0a603c4749dce2ac9b36c3a3c822514ee
'}]
commit_message:
Tests for unlock settings tab from different cluster states

Add tests for Unlock Settings Tab Feature for
partially deployed cluster and for failed
deployment.

Check unlock settings tab after partially deploy
  Scenario:
    1. Revert snapshot ready_with_3_slaves
    2. Create a new env
    3. Add controller and 2 computes
    4. Provision nodes without deploy
    5. Select some nodes (not all) and deploy them
    6. Download current settings and modify some of them
    7. Upload changed settings
    8. Re-deploy cluster
    9. Run OSTF
    10. Make snapshot
  Duration 90m
  Snapshot partially_deployed_unlock

Check unlock settings tab after failed deploy
  Scenario:
    1. Revert snapshot ready_with_3_slaves
    2. Create a new env
    3. Add controller and 2 computes
    4. Change netconfig task to fail deploy
    5. Deploy the env
    6. Download current settings and modify some of them
    7. Upload changed settings
    8. Change netconfig task to normal state
    9. Re-deploy cluster
    10. Run OSTF
    11. Make snapshot

  Duration 60m
  Snapshot failed_deploy_unlock

Change-Id: I84759ae0a603c4749dce2ac9b36c3a3c822514ee

subject: Redefine all get_options methods to be class methods
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-23 09:55:28.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/extras/_saml2/_loading.py', 'keystoneauth1/loading/_plugins/admin_token.py', 'keystoneauth1/loading/_plugins/identity/v2.py', 'keystoneauth1/loading/_plugins/identity/v3.py', 'keystoneauth1/loading/session.py', 'keystoneauth1/loading/_plugins/identity/generic.py', 'keystoneauth1/loading/base.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/loading/utils.py', 'keystoneauth1/loading/identity.py', 'keystoneauth1/extras/oauth1/_loading.py'], 'message': 'Redefine all get_options methods to be class methods

The get_options methods are being used by python-openstackclient and
os-client-config to get the options needed by an auth plugin. These
methods can be defined as class methods as they were in
python-keystoneclient so that they can be called without instantiating
the class, that will fail becase we do not have the right options to
pass to the constructor.

Change-Id: I14c1fde62970a98ae929976d6b5b66788b2f9bd5
'}]
commit_message:
Redefine all get_options methods to be class methods

The get_options methods are being used by python-openstackclient and
os-client-config to get the options needed by an auth plugin. These
methods can be defined as class methods as they were in
python-keystoneclient so that they can be called without instantiating
the class, that will fail becase we do not have the right options to
pass to the constructor.

Change-Id: I14c1fde62970a98ae929976d6b5b66788b2f9bd5

subject: Initialize the tables for DF DB
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-05-19 10:15:53.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/ramcloud_driver', 'dragonflow/cli/df_db.py', 'dragonflow/db/drivers/table_setup_ramcloud.py', 'dragonflow/db/drivers/ramcloud_db_driver.py', 'dragonflow/db/db_api.py', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'dragonflow/db/drivers/redis_db_driver.py', 'dragonflow/db/drivers/etcd_db_driver.py', 'dragonflow/db/drivers/zookeeper_db_driver.py'], 'message': 'Initialize the tables for DF DB

When api_nb module queries each table in Zookeeper or RMC, if there is no
keys in the table, the exception is raised. After a key is created in that
table, the exception no longer appears.

In order to get rid of the exception, we first introduce create_table
and delete_table api for db-api module and then we initialize all the tables
at the system initialization.

Change-Id: I7df838b0e248e808619e17c645efbb71cac91f9e
Closes-Bug: #1548012
'}]
commit_message:
Initialize the tables for DF DB

When api_nb module queries each table in Zookeeper or RMC, if there is no
keys in the table, the exception is raised. After a key is created in that
table, the exception no longer appears.

In order to get rid of the exception, we first introduce create_table
and delete_table api for db-api module and then we initialize all the tables
at the system initialization.

Change-Id: I7df838b0e248e808619e17c645efbb71cac91f9e
Closes-Bug: #1548012

subject: TimeOutException is now reachable
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-23 05:56:52.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/amphorae/drivers/haproxy/rest_api_driver.py'], 'message': 'TimeOutException is now reachable

In the previous commit the 80 characters limit was reached,
it is now fixed.

File - octavia/amphorae/drivers/haproxy/rest_api_driver.py
Class AmphoraAPIClient
Method - request

exception driver_except.TimeOutException() was unreachable due to
incorrect condition statement:
   a >= CONF.haproxy_amphora.connection_max_retries
   ("a" var never reaches connection_max_retries)

Now variable "a" is compared to its maximum possible value

Implements: A valid condition statement
Closes-Bug: 1583558 (Exceeded 80 chars)

Change-Id: I52e9099ea1742c5b00c964e2fc2e62e16d007385
'}]
commit_message:
TimeOutException is now reachable

In the previous commit the 80 characters limit was reached,
it is now fixed.

File - octavia/amphorae/drivers/haproxy/rest_api_driver.py
Class AmphoraAPIClient
Method - request

exception driver_except.TimeOutException() was unreachable due to
incorrect condition statement:
   a >= CONF.haproxy_amphora.connection_max_retries
   ("a" var never reaches connection_max_retries)

Now variable "a" is compared to its maximum possible value

Implements: A valid condition statement
Closes-Bug: 1583558 (Exceeded 80 chars)

Change-Id: I52e9099ea1742c5b00c964e2fc2e62e16d007385

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-05-23 07:00:30.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_agentschedulers_db.py'], 'message': 'Change log level when L3 agent is disabled

Many times administrator don't set "debug=True" in production
environment. If that, we hardly find the root issue if L3 agent
doesn't work when someone disable some L3 agents.

So, change the log level from "debug" into "info" when L3 agent
is disabled.

Change-Id: Ibd5ca5c5479269c17d15b211652737611a5c4c40
'}]
commit_message:
Change log level when L3 agent is disabled

Many times administrator don't set "debug=True" in production
environment. If that, we hardly find the root issue if L3 agent
doesn't work when someone disable some L3 agents.

So, change the log level from "debug" into "info" when L3 agent
is disabled.

Change-Id: Ibd5ca5c5479269c17d15b211652737611a5c4c40

commit_message:
Move models for restrictions to cluster object

Since there are a couple of places where models for
restrictions is initialized, it's moved to cluster object.
Also, comments from previous commit
(Ibba7951968cbafd59fff0d516e74f9dd9e454edc) are fixed

It's refactoring bug is not needed.

Change-Id: Ic499a5deefb12740ebedc630b024dae0b4248ec5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-23 08:38:05.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py'], 'message': 'Fix exception not being properly catched

The code was catching an exception like:

'}]
commit_message:
Fix exception not being properly catched

The code was catching an exception like:

    except Exception:
        raise e

which was wrong. Fix it to actually raise the cached exception.

Change-Id: Ie662c6e998210d877f20f373793b97330d1cabb2

subject: commit 9b47a0f51b759f9af13878ffcc78bce611ad8c95   undefined properties are defined and driven by warlock python object model based on JASON schema and JSON patch.   'tags' undefined property does not hit this code flow and updated via a different code flow.Currently there is no support to replace 'tags' property.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-04 13:40:35.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/v2/schemas.py'], 'message': "commit 9b47a0f51b759f9af13878ffcc78bce611ad8c95
  undefined properties are defined and driven by warlock python object model based on JASON schema and JSON patch.
  'tags' undefined property does not hit this code flow and updated via a different code flow.Currently there is no support to replace 'tags' property.

  Existing code always appends tags replace patch when ever other properties are modified.
  Existing code addresses patch for only tags and this does not look like generic approach to update other properties.

  Closes-Bug: #1555662

Change-Id: I7434e8698ee18ab746745c72942f5a658ea2f8ba
"}]
commit_message:
commit 9b47a0f51b759f9af13878ffcc78bce611ad8c95
  undefined properties are defined and driven by warlock python object model based on JASON schema and JSON patch.
  'tags' undefined property does not hit this code flow and updated via a different code flow.Currently there is no support to replace 'tags' property.

  Existing code always appends tags replace patch when ever other properties are modified.
  Existing code addresses patch for only tags and this does not look like generic approach to update other properties.

  Closes-Bug: #1555662

Change-Id: I7434e8698ee18ab746745c72942f5a658ea2f8ba

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-17 11:31:08.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/datastore.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/vmdk.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_vmware_datastore.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/volumeops.py'], 'message': 'VMware: Reduce volume creation time

The volumes (virtual disks) are created on datastores connected to
ESX hosts in vCenter clusters. Currently we create a list of hosts,
filter out hosts in maintenance mode (using one vCenter API call per
host), and then iterate over the filtered list to select a datastore
which is mounted to maximum number of ESX hosts. Ties are broken
based on space utilization.

This approach is not scalable for vCenter installations with large
number of ESX hosts. Also, we always consider the ESX hosts in the
same order and may end up selecting the same set of datastores. This
patch fixes these issues with the datastore selection. It creates a
list of all datastores in vCenter, which is then filtered to remove
unusable datastores and datastores not satisfying the volume requir-
ements. Finally, we select a datastore from the filtered list based
on the number of ESX hosts to which it is mounted and space utiliza-
tion.

Closes-bug: #1556902
Related-bug: #1521894
Change-Id: I0c505cbe1c82b9cbd2918a223a53a800a9bc7931
(cherry picked from commit 12afec15f265e0c3abf681a6c295987017dab779)
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Reduce volume creation time

The volumes (virtual disks) are created on datastores connected to
ESX hosts in vCenter clusters. Currently we create a list of hosts,
filter out hosts in maintenance mode (using one vCenter API call per
host), and then iterate over the filtered list to select a datastore
which is mounted to maximum number of ESX hosts. Ties are broken
based on space utilization.

This approach is not scalable for vCenter installations with large
number of ESX hosts. Also, we always consider the ESX hosts in the
same order and may end up selecting the same set of datastores. This
patch fixes these issues with the datastore selection. It creates a
list of all datastores in vCenter, which is then filtered to remove
unusable datastores and datastores not satisfying the volume requir-
ements. Finally, we select a datastore from the filtered list based
on the number of ESX hosts to which it is mounted and space utiliza-
tion.

Closes-bug: #1556902
Related-bug: #1521894
Change-Id: I0c505cbe1c82b9cbd2918a223a53a800a9bc7931
(cherry picked from commit 12afec15f265e0c3abf681a6c295987017dab779)

subject: Make sure openstack services are dependent on openstack-core
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 10:33:53.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker_migrations.sh', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': "Make sure openstack services are dependent on openstack-core

Previously ceilometer-notification, aodh-listener and sahara-engine
didn't have constraints that would anchor them under openstack-core
dummy resource. Such constraints are added now. (sahara-engine starting
after sahara-api, aodh-listener after aodh-evaluator, and
ceilometer-notification after openstack-core.) Openstack-core ->
heat-api constraint has been removed because heat-api depends on
ceilometer-notification, so there's a transitive dependency on
openstack-core already.

Change-Id: Ided7321ebbf2c3556726343b4bb466fd8759b43a
Closes-Bug: #1569444
(cherry picked from commit f5d96bb41bb7d19de8649b428fbac8c94f0dfd9d)
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure openstack services are dependent on openstack-core

Previously ceilometer-notification, aodh-listener and sahara-engine
didn't have constraints that would anchor them under openstack-core
dummy resource. Such constraints are added now. (sahara-engine starting
after sahara-api, aodh-listener after aodh-evaluator, and
ceilometer-notification after openstack-core.) Openstack-core ->
heat-api constraint has been removed because heat-api depends on
ceilometer-notification, so there's a transitive dependency on
openstack-core already.

Change-Id: Ided7321ebbf2c3556726343b4bb466fd8759b43a
Closes-Bug: #1569444
(cherry picked from commit f5d96bb41bb7d19de8649b428fbac8c94f0dfd9d)

commit_message:
Use the oslo.utils.reflection to extract class name

The oslo.utils reflection module/code handles more variations
of where a class name may come from (on) python 2 and python 3,
its usage allows getting more accurate class names, so we might
as well use it.

Change-Id: Id570216678b6ceb6dcab8af704d4368c8bb9fb37

commit_message:
Fix encoding errors while working with APIs

Use 'requests' module for HTTP requests to TestRail
and Jenkins API instead of 'urllib'. It provides a
method which decode response data using proper
character encoding (charset from headers) and returns
unicode string.

Also add one more environment variable to settings,
because it's needed by proboscis for test plan
generation (since I9b9d40a59d24f579502a38dfc9b8c142bc219a06
was merged).

Closes-bug: #1584401
Change-Id: I3d6cde2c8066bd58e735142fe26d56e83d1c90de

commit_message:
enable swift pollsters poll data for specific region

Currently swift pollsters only poll data from first region, which
is bad for multiple regions scenario.

This patch enables poll swift data for specific region. And improves
log message and promotes the log level to INFO, now it looks like:

    Swift endpoint not found: public endpoint for object-store
    service in RegionTwo region not found

Change-Id: Ifffb33ba1174a1a54f0ce1c4614bcd35d57ea4c3
Closes-Bug: #1584364

Closes-bug: #1573540

commit_message:
Reload env components page after deployment of empty environment

This patch adds javascript that reloads the page with environment
components until deployment of empty environment is finished. It
allows to add new components to the page without manual page refresh.
Reload is made with timeout set in horizon config
'ajax_poll_interval'. Currently there is no other way to detect the
moment of empty env deployment finish.

Change-Id: I61c43a1891a43bcb53d2894e11e649607c36b2e0
Closes-bug: #1573540

commit_message:
Add verification for latest apps section

When switching projects(tenants) the latest apps did not check whether
the application package is available for deployment in current tenant.
This change adds such check to avoid situations, when a user would
attempt to add an app to environment, that is not available in his
project/tenant.

Change-Id: I9f9c14827932d8187e5815fbbd2f22b1a6801ce8
Closes-Bug: #1558329
(cherry picked from commit 4f1dac1e5e7eb2615a2f37217233732cf0d620a7)

fact that their ids should end with 'password' and 'password-
clone'. But it's not actually true when in application's 'ui.yaml'
file another name for password field is given.
This change adds 'password' to every password field name and id,
and also 'custom_valid' to fields with custom validators to avoid
showing standard warning messages for them.

Change-Id: I4974c221f449b70a46f30e78bfd3cd1b72eeb919
Closes-bug: #1534642
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'password' to names of password fields in dynamic forms

Password-checking javascript selects password fields relying on a
fact that their ids should end with 'password' and 'password-
clone'. But it's not actually true when in application's 'ui.yaml'
file another name for password field is given.
This change adds 'password' to every password field name and id,
and also 'custom_valid' to fields with custom validators to avoid
showing standard warning messages for them.

Change-Id: I4974c221f449b70a46f30e78bfd3cd1b72eeb919
Closes-bug: #1534642

subject: More MTU cleanups for Neutron
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7307, 'name': 'Matt Thompson', 'email': 'mattt@defunct.ca', 'username': 'mattt416'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 14805, 'name': 'Jimmy McCrory', 'email': 'jimmy.mccrory@gmail.com', 'username': 'jimmy-mccrory'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-19 01:24:53.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/neutron-mtu-cleanup-ce73693b4f7aef0d.yaml', 'templates/neutron.conf.j2', 'templates/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "More MTU cleanups for Neutron

Since Mitaka, Neutron does the right job, calculating MTU for networks
and advertising them thru DHCP and RA.

1. Don't disable MTU advertisement in neutron.conf (advertise_mtu).
2. Don't disable MTU calculation (path_mtu = 0, segment_mtu = 0).
3. Don't set network_device_mtu (it breaks data path and is deprecated).

Change-Id: I28536c5a13711c8e82d056fb47567234aab4e547
"}]
commit_message:
More MTU cleanups for Neutron

Since Mitaka, Neutron does the right job, calculating MTU for networks
and advertising them thru DHCP and RA.

1. Don't disable MTU advertisement in neutron.conf (advertise_mtu).
2. Don't disable MTU calculation (path_mtu = 0, segment_mtu = 0).
3. Don't set network_device_mtu (it breaks data path and is deprecated).

Change-Id: I28536c5a13711c8e82d056fb47567234aab4e547

commit_message:
l3: Reject requests to connect to non-midonet networks gracefully

This can easily happen with ML2.

While MidoNet (backend) would reject those requests anyway,
it's more user-friendly to reject them here.

Closes-Bug: #1555384
Change-Id: Ia27c12f2f7f5edd2004671b996cce882ac8a6f79

commit_message:
Fix and improve the partition coordinator

* Fix the partition coordinator to distribute tasks properly.

* Improve the partition coordination mechanism in retry logic, exception
  handling, and log messages, etc. Refer to the Ceilometer's changes:

- Icf60381e30f3baf986cf9e008e133287765d9827
- I6a48cf38b24a00a0db94d3dea0c6746b52526026
- Ic0b6b62dace88e4e1ce7932024350bb211efb9ef
- I8100160a3aa83a190c4110e6e8be9b26aef8fd1c
- I2aed2241ded798464089b3eec5e1394422a45844

Closes-Bug: #1575530
Change-Id: I5729ae3080898e8a6d92889f8c520174dc371113
(cherry picked from commit dd06bf9277774c56121be0b4878c8973f38e761d)

commit_message:
Soft-code ML2 configuration

Using the original configurations in legacy to soft-code the
following ML2 configurations.

- tenant_network_types <== Q_ML2_TENANT_NETWORK_TYPE
- type_drivers <== Q_ML2_PLUGIN_TYPE_DRIVERS
- mechanism_drivers <== Q_ML2_PLUGIN_MECHANISM_DRIVERS
- ml2_type_vxlan vni_ranges <== ML2_VLAN_RANGES

Change-Id: Idac83c00e8d01631e10eb9f22ac14f6a4ac98fab

Configurable enabled plugins list for Sahara

This patch add support to configure the enabled plugin list

Set proper public_endpoint in ironic.conf

Ironic requires correct public endpoint url set in config to avoid issues with
HTTPS links to resources.

Closes-bug: #1571610
(cherry picked from commit 0a264f504a56ef7a3e592957d55d62d05a862612)

commit_message:
Make keystone session stickiness optional

As part of Bug 1527717, we added in support of session stickiness for
keystone to allow for federation support in keystone. This introduced
performance issues with keystone and should not be configured by
default. This change disables the stickiness by default but allows for
it to be enabled by adding a 'federation' key to the keystone hiera
hash.

DocImpact: Keystone HAProxy session stickiness can be enabled by adding
a 'federation' key to the keystone hiera configuration. By default
session stickiness is disabled.

Change-Id: Id43446a9f923417b8fa140ffcfddb6797f1b4e48
Related-Bug: #1527717
Closes-Bug: #1582202
(cherry picked from commit 8ebe5f15474319fafe2cdae2fc74ee98d63dcb80)

commit_message:
Volume manage should get the floor of volume size

The function manage_existing_object_get_size return the ceiling of
volume size in LVM backend but in the other backends(emc, ceph, huawei) 
that function return the floor of volume size. So it also should
return the floor of volume size in LVM backend.

Change-Id: Ie44afd6dabc6ed4f37ce16b048770a4bee4e4cf4
Closes-Bug: #1584567

commit_message:
Use constraints for all the things

This configures tox to use upper-constraints for everything, except
environments used for post jobs (as constraints aren't supported there
yet).

Change-Id: I24949553ae7161e0d9c0cf17de5154fae6c3b22e

commit_message:
Vagrant: Add support for parallels and libvirt

This change adds support for using both parallels and libvirt as the Vagrant
hypervisor backend.

Note this change is untested, but should in theory work. Those running
Vagrant with parallels or libvirt are welcome to try this out.

Change-Id: I23511fec12238a8e3bcccea4874101d9e66c7612
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

subject: Add batch control for node action scheduling
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-23 07:15:12.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/scheduler.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/test_scheduler.py', 'senlin/common/config.py'], 'message': 'Add batch control for node action scheduling

This patch adds batch control for node action scheduling.
A configure option is added to define the batch size of node
actions that each engine worker can schedule consecutively.
There will be one second interval between scheduling of two
batch of node actions.

Change-Id: I908c539fb34dc6f63fd1f88014e301c19461cb87
'}]
commit_message:
Add batch control for node action scheduling

This patch adds batch control for node action scheduling.
A configure option is added to define the batch size of node
actions that each engine worker can schedule consecutively.
There will be one second interval between scheduling of two
batch of node actions.

Change-Id: I908c539fb34dc6f63fd1f88014e301c19461cb87

adds node name regex filter api support

support to filter nodes by regex string.

commit_message:
Tune health manager options

This patch massages the options related to periodic tasks. It is a
preparation for future improvement to the health manager. Note that the
options changes are all transparent to users, i.e. they still belong to
the [default] section.

Change-Id: I7317264ba2ac4aeeade8915a9cb4afedd50edc2a

commit_message:
Leverage common/acl in existing core_plugin

This patch removes the duplicated code from plugin.py thats in
common/acl.py. The main motivation behind this patch is to help
consolidate changes so that the ml2 plugin is using the same code
as the core_plugin which is being tested in the gate and removing
the code duplication.

Change-Id: I68c5a589a6f814152cc9b474efb5a5aa5759c240

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-20 23:20:45.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/unit/test_ovn_plugin.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/common/test_acl.py', 'networking_ovn/plugin.py', 'networking_ovn/common/acl.py'], 'message': 'ACL updates for protocol names and numbers

Support tcp, udp, icmp, icmpv6 and ipv6-icmp protocol names
and their associated numbers. Neutron supports both protocol
names and numbers and stores them as strings in the database.
This patch set enables ML2 to support the additional protocol
names and numbers. It also fixes the core plugin support to
use string comparison.

Change-Id: Ife86de5b8e610e5209f89e359da353993639e8ab
Partial-Bug: #1578198
Partial-Bug: #1573465
'}]
commit_message:
ACL updates for protocol names and numbers

Support tcp, udp, icmp, icmpv6 and ipv6-icmp protocol names
and their associated numbers. Neutron supports both protocol
names and numbers and stores them as strings in the database.
This patch set enables ML2 to support the additional protocol
names and numbers. It also fixes the core plugin support to
use string comparison.

Change-Id: Ife86de5b8e610e5209f89e359da353993639e8ab
Partial-Bug: #1578198
Partial-Bug: #1573465

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-17 15:27:55.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/hitachi/test_hds_hnas.py', 'manila/share/drivers/hitachi/hds_hnas.py'], 'message': 'HDS_HNAS: Fix improper error message

When attempting to delete a snapshot, if the filesystem is
unmounted, the error message is the output of the delete command.
The delete command should not be invoked in such scenario, and
a proper message should be included in the exception.

Change-Id: If60f8644d4aebf5f364de44c6bef8085d2e539f7
Closes-bug: #1582747
'}]
commit_message:
HDS_HNAS: Fix improper error message

When attempting to delete a snapshot, if the filesystem is
unmounted, the error message is the output of the delete command.
The delete command should not be invoked in such scenario, and
a proper message should be included in the exception.

Change-Id: If60f8644d4aebf5f364de44c6bef8085d2e539f7
Closes-bug: #1582747

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-19 12:08:38.000000000', 'files': ['etc/cinder/api-paste.ini'], 'message': "Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of cinder. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request url correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Cinder.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Cinder, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Iba2a5ac49ab251f6637446b9715157d2ce33ab5d
"}]
commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of cinder. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request url correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Cinder.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Cinder, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Iba2a5ac49ab251f6637446b9715157d2ce33ab5d

subject: Update get_arg_list_as_str to skip func params
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-21 16:56:44.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/utils/inspect_utils.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/utils/test_inspect_utils.py'], 'message': "Update get_arg_list_as_str to skip func params

This patch updates inspect_utils.get_arg_list_as_str
so that it skips handling parameters that can't be
JSON serialized. One example of this would be a function
parameter (func=time.sleep). Some of the OpenStack
clients have functions that would be useful to expose
by simply relying on the default settings for these
parameters.

Change-Id: Id1cc8e79db3001ffec5066b2e81ec2e5119e875a
Closes-bug: #1584366
"}]
commit_message:
Update get_arg_list_as_str to skip func params

This patch updates inspect_utils.get_arg_list_as_str
so that it skips handling parameters that can't be
JSON serialized. One example of this would be a function
parameter (func=time.sleep). Some of the OpenStack
clients have functions that would be useful to expose
by simply relying on the default settings for these
parameters.

Change-Id: Id1cc8e79db3001ffec5066b2e81ec2e5119e875a
Closes-bug: #1584366

commit_message:
Minimize element usage

Further reduces reliance on elements and moves more logic to puppet.
With this patch, the list of elements being used in the undercloud is
quite small and much easier to reason about logically.

This patch depends on a packaging update for instack-undercloud:
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/1074/

blueprint undercloud-elements
Change-Id: If6036e9eb68e0af1e1989918d310c8ddf57b9622

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-19 07:44:50.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Remove html_static_path from api-ref

In Id3a71841f5b9a9ea7bb5803afd967ab4feadfe10 the in tree copy of
os-api-ref was migrated to the upstream version. The html_static_path
setting in conf.py was forgotten in the patch, which caused a warning

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I267b3f671fdfa2033c24d9407c7bed7e8527e9a2

commit_message:
Remove html_static_path from api-ref

In Id3a71841f5b9a9ea7bb5803afd967ab4feadfe10 the in tree copy of
os-api-ref was migrated to the upstream version. The html_static_path
setting in conf.py was forgotten in the patch, which caused a warning
when building the API reference.
This patch comments out the setting from conf.py to prevent the
warning.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I267b3f671fdfa2033c24d9407c7bed7e8527e9a2

commit_message:
Fixed require statements for puppet 4

This change updates the require statements in the providers
to resolve the issues with the autoloader in puppet. This
issue technically always existed but was masked prior to the
split with puppet server and puppet agent because both used to
share the same loadpath. Documentation on this issue can be
read at https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-4450.

Change-Id: I72a27fe92a41a5eb845adba6b82252b8aac1c164
(cherry picked from commit 06a9784af4fb49d0201e21982270701346afb743)

Now we have two key parameters for queue's constructor: auto_create
and force_create. Though we're trying to make the name can explain

Change-Id: I4beee2c2d01cab1988e8b28e220996336431dba1

commit_message:
Refactor queue create

Now we have two key parameters for queue's constructor: auto_create
and force_create. Though we're trying to make the name can explain
itself, we're stilling missing a case when the foce_create is True
but auto_create is Flase. So this case, the queue should be created
as well. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I4beee2c2d01cab1988e8b28e220996336431dba1

subject: Register a log formatter for stack event list
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-29 22:58:34.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_event.py', 'heatclient/osc/v1/event.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Register a log formatter for stack event list

Currently "stack event list" overrides the value formatter to use for
the default log formatting style. This change creates a formatter
namespace for event list so that it can have its own custom list of
formatters.

This means that the 'log' formatter is now registered and is the
default. The formatter expects event objects rather than dicts, and
so ignores the columns argument.

The intention is that this will be the first of more custom formatters
for event list, making the effort to establish this pattern worth it.

Change-Id: I22f884f871d7467c8abadec477b3e732eb8c2150
'}]
commit_message:
Register a log formatter for stack event list

Currently "stack event list" overrides the value formatter to use for
the default log formatting style. This change creates a formatter
namespace for event list so that it can have its own custom list of
formatters.

This means that the 'log' formatter is now registered and is the
default. The formatter expects event objects rather than dicts, and
so ignores the columns argument.

The intention is that this will be the first of more custom formatters
for event list, making the effort to establish this pattern worth it.

Change-Id: I22f884f871d7467c8abadec477b3e732eb8c2150

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-22 16:06:57.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/utils.py'], 'message': 'Add new functionality to @wip

@wip now will take a bugid argument and an expected exception. If
the exception raised is different than the expected exception the
test will fail. The bug id is to ensure we have a clear way of tracking
bugs when @wip is used (rather than hoping it is just in the "message"
string).

Change-Id: Id3814b9ce299300a3c97d4ee0b55666be237172a
'}]
commit_message:
Add new functionality to @wip

@wip now will take a bugid argument and an expected exception. If
the exception raised is different than the expected exception the
test will fail. The bug id is to ensure we have a clear way of tracking
bugs when @wip is used (rather than hoping it is just in the "message"
string).

Change-Id: Id3814b9ce299300a3c97d4ee0b55666be237172a

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Implement nova rescue

The root disk image is moved to a separate disk slot while the
rescue image will take it's place. If the instance requires it,
a temporary config drive is created as well.

Unrescuing the instance will move the root disk image back in
place, removing temporary images.

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint hyper-v-rescue

Change-Id: I6059ae35a77d675f54b98b2b43b5762e1d24365b

subject: Fix AttributeError on cached-invalid token checks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-21 06:14:35.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/auth_token/test_auth_token_middleware.py', 'keystonemiddleware/auth_token/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Fix AttributeError on cached-invalid token checks

Starting with v4.5.0, if a token is found to be cached, but is cached
with an invalid state, the middleware attempts to log a debug message
indicating as much.

However, the logger it attempts to use does not exist and results in
an AttributeError. As a result, this yields HTTP 500 responses once
the invalid token gets cached and is attempted to be used again,
rather than the expected 401.

This fixes the reference and adds a test to ensure the expected log
entry ends up in the logger so that this condition in
AuthProtocol.fetch_token now gets coverage.

Change-Id: Ie391973ea5893531c0b590ffba2d9de7f7f19d94
Closes-bug: #1584289
'}]
commit_message:
Fix AttributeError on cached-invalid token checks

Starting with v4.5.0, if a token is found to be cached, but is cached
with an invalid state, the middleware attempts to log a debug message
indicating as much.

However, the logger it attempts to use does not exist and results in
an AttributeError. As a result, this yields HTTP 500 responses once
the invalid token gets cached and is attempted to be used again,
rather than the expected 401.

This fixes the reference and adds a test to ensure the expected log
entry ends up in the logger so that this condition in
AuthProtocol.fetch_token now gets coverage.

Change-Id: Ie391973ea5893531c0b590ffba2d9de7f7f19d94
Closes-bug: #1584289

commit_message:
[training-guides] associate: using Dashboard

This "using Dashboard" chapter aims to describe
how to use OpenStack Dashboard for associate-level users.

This commit mainly focuses on the conversion from xml to rst,
so more explanations such as launching a VM, injecting a SSH key,
and changing SecGrp are encourged with figures.

Change-Id: Idcbadbe1af11b1b48b8f49159181a9306cea94d4
Partial-Bug: #1493088

commit_message:
Resize API operation passing down original RequestSpec

We modified the RPC interface for resizes able to pass down a RequestSpec
object, but only evacuate API operation was using it. We need to do the same
for the general resize case.

Partially-Implements: blueprint check-destination-on-migrations-newton

Change-Id: Iea737a5a9b3d3f7770c62f82cc30cde13eb4fe09

commit_message:
Remove openstack-doc-test

openstack-doc-test is used for building of DocBook XML files. For index
page generation openstack-indexpage can be used.

Remove openstack-doc-test together with all support files.

Change-Id: I5589bc634e1f630f79b3d6e8bffee939c5300bf2

commit_message:
Add another queue before the processor, dedicated for evaluator events.
Evaluator and processor are on the same process, thus should not use the multiprocessing queue between them.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-20 20:29:43.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Add error logging around FIP delete

To help catch leaking floating IPs, let's add some logging that
might help us find out what's happening. We've been silently

"}]
commit_message:
Add error logging around FIP delete

To help catch leaking floating IPs, let's add some logging that
might help us find out what's happening. We've been silently
throwing away exceptions from the delete API that might help us
narrow down the cause.

Change-Id: Ia54a19015725b1d10d3d36301e0aab7bae3e3f60

commit_message:
Add another queue before the processor, dedicated for evaluator events.
Evaluator and processor are on the same process, thus should not use the multiprocessing queue between them.

Change-Id: I277aeaaab48352b594191e2c281f286994d2ff51

subject: Switch to a new service type "container-infra"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-20 22:58:59.000000000', 'files': ['magnumclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'magnumclient/tests/v1/test_client.py', 'magnumclient/v1/client.py', 'magnumclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Switch to a new service type "container-infra"

After this patch [1], Magnum is no longer the "Container Service", it
became the "Container Infrastructure Management Service". Based on the
decision, this patch proposed to rename Magnum service type from
"container" to "container-infra". The old service type will be
deprecated and eventually not supported.

There is another patch [2] on Magnum server side for the renaming.
This patch should land first, then the server patch.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/311476/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/319300/

Change-Id: I55205ff2b304678d2b53bbd4d66403078c6baac8
Closes-Bug: #1584251
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to a new service type "container-infra"

After this patch [1], Magnum is no longer the "Container Service", it
became the "Container Infrastructure Management Service". Based on the
decision, this patch proposed to rename Magnum service type from
"container" to "container-infra". The old service type will be
deprecated and eventually not supported.

There is another patch [2] on Magnum server side for the renaming.
This patch should land first, then the server patch.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/311476/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/319300/

Change-Id: I55205ff2b304678d2b53bbd4d66403078c6baac8
Closes-Bug: #1584251

commit_message:
Vagrant: Add support for parallels and libvirt

This change adds support for using both parallels and libvirt as the Vagrant
hypervisor backend.

Note this change is untested, but should in theory work. Those running
Vagrant with parallels or libvirt are welcome to try this out.

Change-Id: Id96ba816dac4f7c24f1f74f8a1c9e46b1941cf3f
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

commit_message:
Manage existing volume with invalid host

A volume with invalid host is created when manage existing
volume with actions via Horizon dashboard, where it's entered
invalid host name. This patch fixes it, that is, it's not allow
to create a volume with invalid host.

Change-Id: Idd32f06c2f6c14813e21c83fde8671c41eb03653
Closes-Bug: #1580095
(cherry picked from commit eb1315bb5c416952295067d7d5f6c970d367123c)

commit_message:
Fix tests to work with current release

This change dynamically picks the release directory
based on the fact that they are in alphabetical order.
This should avoid having to modify the current_release
variable at the beginning of each cycle.

Fixes errors in trove-image-build.rst since the
tests weren't being run in the right directory.

Change-Id: If8f84d25fbdde14103db56304eba92abc93dc4ee

commit_message:
NetApp: Use Local Cache to Copy an Available Image

This defect fixes the issue where a locally cached image is not
always used by the Copy Offload feature. By using an available
image, local to the same backend as the share, performance can be
improved as a clone operation is executed instead of a remote copy.

Also, moved and refactored tests from test_netapp_nfs.py to the
correct test class under the netapp driver test directory. This is
part of the ongoing refactoring of test_netapp_nfs.py to meet
current code standards.

Change-Id: Ia4d4435d81d2f7dabd12582553b89f9b9d5ab38a
(cherry picked from fdca451cbd6f04fe6ace4232da42093495facf6d)
Closes-Bug: 1568998

subject: Bump django-babel minimal requirement to 0.5.1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-19 19:25:10.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Bump django-babel minimal requirement to 0.5.1

django-babel 0.5.1 adds Django blocktrans 'trimmed' option support
and it is required to fix horizon bug 1583757.

upper-constraints already uses django-babel 0.5.1, so there is
no need to update it.

Related-Bug: #1583757
Change-Id: I534895be0d5f4bf0429b1511ee5421991386c873
"}]
commit_message:
Bump django-babel minimal requirement to 0.5.1

django-babel 0.5.1 adds Django blocktrans 'trimmed' option support
and it is required to fix horizon bug 1583757.

upper-constraints already uses django-babel 0.5.1, so there is
no need to update it.

Related-Bug: #1583757

commit_message:
Bump aodhclient to 0.5.0

This change is because the aodhclient-0.1.0 is the first initial version
of aodhclient, it only provided some primitive functionalities. Until
aodhclient-0.5.0, it has provided a set of relatively well-integrated
functionalites. We are going to port aodhclient to Heat with change[1], so
it is better to bump aodhclient to version 0.5.0.

[1] I35803c0d5f43b214dda7abdcd69a33b4cd0c2646

Change-Id: I083c9ddbfa4f0f98da20900cb8eeaca38eb4d07b
