[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-19 17:09:53.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'projects.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Add os-vif release 1.0.0

* os-vif is a new module maintained by a combination of devs
  from the nova and neutron teams

* os-vif 1.0.0 is mostly new code, though some has been
  extracted from existing Nova. It has undergone extensive
  design review and code review by nova & neutron teams prior
  to the 1.0.0 release

* os-vif is tested on python 2 & 3 and expected to be fully
  compatible with both

* os-vif is under the normal Apache license of openstack
  projects

* os-vif will need to be packaged by downsteam vendors when
  updating nova

* os-vif is filling a function not addressed by any existing

Change-Id: Ied449451e34c8c2749aef9dcae1df02f81f7ac08
'}]
commit_message:
Add os-vif release 1.0.0

* os-vif is a new module maintained by a combination of devs
  from the nova and neutron teams

* os-vif 1.0.0 is mostly new code, though some has been
  extracted from existing Nova. It has undergone extensive
  design review and code review by nova & neutron teams prior
  to the 1.0.0 release

* os-vif is tested on python 2 & 3 and expected to be fully
  compatible with both

* os-vif is under the normal Apache license of openstack
  projects

* os-vif will need to be packaged by downsteam vendors when
  updating nova

* os-vif is filling a function not addressed by any existing
  python project, since it is addressing an entirely new use
  case for integration between nova & neutron

Change-Id: Ied449451e34c8c2749aef9dcae1df02f81f7ac08

subject: Drop python-ldap from global requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-21 00:12:42.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Drop python-ldap from global requirements

With keystone moving to pyldap (and ldappool requiring pyldap) there is
no longer a dependency on python-ldap in OpenStack as far as I have
been able to determine. This patch drops python-ldap in favor of
pyldap which is python3 compatible and a drop-in replacement for
python-ldap (it was forked from pyton-ldap).

Change-Id: Iff153146c2e94842d203204359477511028ecdbc
'}]
commit_message:
Drop python-ldap from global requirements

With keystone moving to pyldap (and ldappool requiring pyldap) there is
no longer a dependency on python-ldap in OpenStack as far as I have
been able to determine. This patch drops python-ldap in favor of
pyldap which is python3 compatible and a drop-in replacement for
python-ldap (it was forked from pyton-ldap).

Change-Id: Iff153146c2e94842d203204359477511028ecdbc

subject: Remove helper script for py34
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-21 23:47:02.000000000', 'files': ['tools/pretty_tox_py3.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove helper script for py34

Remove the helper script for py34, it prevents the use of arguments
being passed down e.g. tox -epy34 -- --failing due to the lack of
passing {posargs} to the script. Since py34 has no special exceptions
now, the specific env for py34 with a special pretty_tox script is
not needed.

Change-Id: I4d960d82e2844c0c82a14be5e92230f1698e11b3
'}]
commit_message:
Remove helper script for py34

Remove the helper script for py34, it prevents the use of arguments
being passed down e.g. tox -epy34 -- --failing due to the lack of
passing {posargs} to the script. Since py34 has no special exceptions
now, the specific env for py34 with a special pretty_tox script is
not needed.

Change-Id: I4d960d82e2844c0c82a14be5e92230f1698e11b3

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-18 22:45:28.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'cinder/utils.py'], 'message': "Remove object to dictionary translation logic

If cinder manages hundred of volumes, the cinder
volume service is taking a long time to start up.

Most of time is spent at object to dictionary
conversion in list_of_dicts_to_dict().

  dict(d, index=d[key])

We should remove this logic to avoid performance
degradation, and then use simple iteration for
referring volume object same as snapshot.

Also snapshot_update() in _sync_provider_info()
would be better to use 'update' instead of 'updt'.

Change-Id: Idde635b9c488e40e53377e0f3b48c8478df97a84
Closes-Bug: #1582505
(cherry picked from commit ad9436e5af2591d7b6612def8bf6ceda4f76be02)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove object to dictionary translation logic

If cinder manages hundred of volumes, the cinder
volume service is taking a long time to start up.

Most of time is spent at object to dictionary
conversion in list_of_dicts_to_dict().

  dict(d, index=d[key])

We should remove this logic to avoid performance
degradation, and then use simple iteration for
referring volume object same as snapshot.

Also snapshot_update() in _sync_provider_info()
would be better to use 'update' instead of 'updt'.

Change-Id: Idde635b9c488e40e53377e0f3b48c8478df97a84
Closes-Bug: #1582505
(cherry picked from commit ad9436e5af2591d7b6612def8bf6ceda4f76be02)

commit_message:
Fix image tests to use warlock resources

We have been testing (incorrectly) Image v2 using our usual
FakeResource objects, when the v2 API actually uses warlock
schema modelled resources.

Bring this to the tests (TestImageSet was already doing this)

Change-Id: Ia6ed3a8e28a8961f770c241b49d47cce9ff328d3

commit_message:
Implement CHAP Authentication for E-Series Driver

This patch adds CHAP authentication support for the NetApp E-Series
iSCSI driver by reusing the existing Cinder configuration options
use_chap_auth, chap_username, and chap_password.

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Jose Porrua <jose.porrua@netapp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rushil Chugh <rushil@netapp.com>
Implements: bp netapp-eseries-chap-authentication
Change-Id: I5353fa8683e975e66a6b15d1db99bb6920cd0511

commit_message:
Set Zaqar storage/message_pipeline correctly

Update the default zaqar configuration so we set the
storage/message_queue parameter to 'zaqar.notification.notifier'
which is required if you want to be able to do something like
subscribe to a queue and recieve notifications over a websocket.

Change-Id: I7a158dc670b899189d5846a1d02f8228016aa5cc
Depends-On: I14eade5ef0ac64f8856bfa455c4f9aaf51dd6c8d

commit_message:
oidc: add OidcAccessToken class to authenticate reusing an access token

Some services or users may have obtained an access token, so it would be
possible to authenticate using this token directly (for example a
service where the user has already logged in). This new class makes
possible to use an access token to authenticate directly with Keystone,
exchanging it for a Keystone token.

Closes-bug: 1583780
Change-Id: I5a31270194a3d1aa48de709dba49afde460731e2

subject: Fix apt-sources configuration for debian-minimal
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-13 07:28:55.000000000', 'files': ['elements/debootstrap/root.d/08-debootstrap', 'elements/debian-minimal/environment.d/10-debian-minimal.bash', 'elements/debian/test-elements/build-succeeds/environment.d/09-debian-stable', 'elements/debian/test-elements/build-succeeds/environment.d/10-debian-stable', 'elements/debian-minimal/pre-install.d/01-debian-apt-update', 'elements/debian-minimal/pre-install.d/02-debian-apt-update', 'elements/debian-minimal/README.rst'], 'message': 'Fix apt-sources configuration for debian-minimal

The apt-sources element did not work with debian-minimal, because
the later one overwrote the /etc/apt/sources.list file created by
the apt-sources element.

Two changes were made:
o the debian-minimal uses now files inside the /etc/apt/sources.list.d
  directory.  Therefore there is no possibilty for clashes between those
  two elements any more.
o instead of only adding backports, also the updates and the security
  repository is added by default which gives perfect initial
  configuration for a stable system.
  If you want to use local mirrors with other naming schemas or an
  unstable tree, there is the possibility to fully specify the
  repositories.

Change-Id: I69dbaa34be3db3d667e6bd8450ef4ce04a751c70
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix apt-sources configuration for debian-minimal

The apt-sources element did not work with debian-minimal, because
the later one overwrote the /etc/apt/sources.list file created by
the apt-sources element.

Two changes were made:
o the debian-minimal uses now files inside the /etc/apt/sources.list.d
  directory.  Therefore there is no possibilty for clashes between those
  two elements any more.
o instead of only adding backports, also the updates and the security
  repository is added by default which gives perfect initial
  configuration for a stable system.
  If you want to use local mirrors with other naming schemas or an
  unstable tree, there is the possibility to fully specify the
  repositories.

Change-Id: I69dbaa34be3db3d667e6bd8450ef4ce04a751c70
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

subject: Register k8s node but make it unschedulable
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-20 20:48:13.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/templates/kubernetes/fragments/configure-kubernetes-master.sh'], 'message': 'Register k8s node but make it unschedulable

In before, we configure k8s master node by using
"--register-node=false". This seems to work but will produce verbose
error message in the log [1]. Starting from v1.2, there is a new
option "--register-schedulable". We can use the combination of both
options to register the master node but make it unschedulable. This
can suppress the verbose error message.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/15108

Closes-Bug: #1584198
Change-Id: I72cc360e08b647bf239b62af6a7fd87ca14c604e
'}]
commit_message:
Register k8s node but make it unschedulable

In before, we configure k8s master node by using
"--register-node=false". This seems to work but will produce verbose
error message in the log [1]. Starting from v1.2, there is a new
option "--register-schedulable". We can use the combination of both
options to register the master node but make it unschedulable. This
can suppress the verbose error message.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/15108

Closes-Bug: #1584198
Change-Id: I72cc360e08b647bf239b62af6a7fd87ca14c604e

This review is to prepare for adding monasca-persister into openstack
global-requirements. After this project gets into global requirements,

'}]
commit_message:
[monasca-persister] Constraint tox targets with upper-constraints

source based specifier before applying it to pip install.

revisions:
[{'number': 59, 'created': '2016-05-20 16:00:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/driver.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/pathutils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_vmops.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_livemigrationops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_pathutils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_eventhandler.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/constants.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/livemigrationops.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/eventhandler.py'], 'message': 'HyperV: Nova serial console access support

Hyper-V provides a solid interface for accessing serial ports via
named pipes, already employed in the Nova serial console log
implementation.

This patch makes use of this interface by implementing a simple TCP
socket proxy, providing access to instance serial console ports.

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint hyperv-serial-ports

Change-Id: I58c328391a80ee8b81f66b2e09a1bfa4b26e584c
'}]
commit_message:
HyperV: Nova serial console access support

Hyper-V provides a solid interface for accessing serial ports via
named pipes, already employed in the Nova serial console log
implementation.

This patch makes use of this interface by implementing a simple TCP
socket proxy, providing access to instance serial console ports.

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint hyperv-serial-ports

Change-Id: I58c328391a80ee8b81f66b2e09a1bfa4b26e584c

subject: Add other-requirements.txt for bindep
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-19 22:15:55.000000000', 'files': ['other-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Add other-requirements.txt for bindep

Bindep is a binary automation tool used in openstack-infra.  With it,
projects can better control the default packages installed into the
OS. Because we are using puppet, we actually don't want any packages
installed by default as to better test our manifests.

Change-Id: I7a903e8c492c0237815434e2ae1ae56bd2226d09
Co-Authored-By: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add other-requirements.txt for bindep

Bindep is a binary automation tool used in openstack-infra.  With it,
projects can better control the default packages installed into the
OS. Because we are using puppet, we actually don't want any packages
installed by default as to better test our manifests.

Change-Id: I7a903e8c492c0237815434e2ae1ae56bd2226d09
Co-Authored-By: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Deprecate verbose parameter

Option "verbose" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated for removal.
The parameter has no effect.
-Deprecated verbose for logging and init
-Remove verbose in README
-Remove verbose from tests.
If this option is not set explicitly, there is no such warning

Change-Id: Ib9cddc4f1b1b03e85118fa3c8390b69b02e7dd7f

subject: Add params to configure zaqar storage pipelines
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-18 23:43:04.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/zaqar_init_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'message': "Add params to configure zaqar storage pipelines

This patch adds parameters to configure the storage/*_pipeline
parameters for zaqar. These parameters are quite useful is you
wish to recieve notifications for Zaqar. In particular the
message_pipeline would often get set to 'zaqar.notification.notifier'
so that messages that have been subscribed to could be recieved.

Zaqar upstream has these set to nothing upstream so for now
setting the default to $os_service_default seems reasonable.

Change-Id: I14eade5ef0ac64f8856bfa455c4f9aaf51dd6c8d
"}]
commit_message:
Add params to configure zaqar storage pipelines

This patch adds parameters to configure the storage/*_pipeline
parameters for zaqar. These parameters are quite useful is you
wish to recieve notifications for Zaqar. In particular the
message_pipeline would often get set to 'zaqar.notification.notifier'
so that messages that have been subscribed to could be recieved.

Zaqar upstream has these set to nothing upstream so for now
setting the default to $os_service_default seems reasonable.

Change-Id: I14eade5ef0ac64f8856bfa455c4f9aaf51dd6c8d

The db_max_retries parameter regulates the number of reconnection
attempts performed after an error raised rather than at startup.

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary v3 VolumeController.__init__

Method cinder.api.v3.volumes.VolumeController.__init__ is just calling
its parent with the same arguments it receives, so it's unnecessary and
can be removed.

Change-Id: I67e79f59fd95ec47a4c3dbce7d66a93ba38c1ab6

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-05-19 08:29:03.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_base.py', 'cinder/exception.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Prevent Multitable conditional updates

Since PostgreSQL doesn't support multitable updates we want to raise an
exception whenever we try to do such queries, even if they would have
succeeded with MySQL.

That way, if we have a multitable query in our code base that is not
getting tested in our PostgreSQL CI job, at least it will always fail on
devstack deployments even when they use the MySQL DB engine when the
query gets executed.

Without this patch we just wouldn't see the issue on our devstack
deployment that uses MySQL, as multitable operations are supported.

Change-Id: Ib45d3fb6b6c580615f4685e3d6f70705f1afffe9
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent Multitable conditional updates

Since PostgreSQL doesn't support multitable updates we want to raise an
exception whenever we try to do such queries, even if they would have
succeeded with MySQL.

That way, if we have a multitable query in our code base that is not
getting tested in our PostgreSQL CI job, at least it will always fail on
devstack deployments even when they use the MySQL DB engine when the
query gets executed.

Without this patch we just wouldn't see the issue on our devstack
deployment that uses MySQL, as multitable operations are supported.

Change-Id: Ib45d3fb6b6c580615f4685e3d6f70705f1afffe9

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-21 09:07:41.000000000', 'files': ['other-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Add other-requirements.txt for bindep

Bindep is a binary automation tool used in openstack-infra.  With it,
projects can better control the default packages installed into the
OS. Because we are using puppet, we actually don't want any packages
installed by default as to better test our manifests.

Change-Id: I7d93fe2f13def8b72c5ed1a81dc47573cdae5f26

"}]
commit_message:
Add other-requirements.txt for bindep

Bindep is a binary automation tool used in openstack-infra.  With it,
projects can better control the default packages installed into the
OS. Because we are using puppet, we actually don't want any packages
installed by default as to better test our manifests.

Change-Id: I7d93fe2f13def8b72c5ed1a81dc47573cdae5f26
Co-Authored-By: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-18 21:31:36.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/parameters.yaml', 'api-ref/source/os-baremetal-nodes.inc'], 'message': "api-ref: complete verification of baremetal api

This cleans up the baremetal proxy, which was horribly inaccurate (the
paths weren't right after the method verification)

A warning is stuck in the preamble, we really don't want people using
this. Parameters are documented as best as we could from Nova
source. Honestly, people should just talk to ironic directly and use
their docs.

Part of bp:api-ref-in-rst

Change-Id: I66e85f414e5f0edbf052ba56691294a94615c619
"}]
commit_message:
api-ref: complete verification of baremetal api

This cleans up the baremetal proxy, which was horribly inaccurate (the
paths weren't right after the method verification)

A warning is stuck in the preamble, we really don't want people using
this. Parameters are documented as best as we could from Nova
source. Honestly, people should just talk to ironic directly and use
their docs.

Part of bp:api-ref-in-rst

Change-Id: I66e85f414e5f0edbf052ba56691294a94615c619

commit_message:
Add other-requirements.txt for bindep

Bindep is a binary automation tool used in openstack-infra.  With it,
projects can better control the default packages installed into the
OS. Because we are using puppet, we actually don't want any packages
installed by default as to better test our manifests.

Change-Id: I8a543706fcc27d2fcb3aa04b82b0b3b8d376f5d1
Co-Authored-By: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Scrub residual devices before connect volume

Scrub residual device paths, sd devices and multipath device shells,
otherwise, connect volume maybe raise exception by reason of residual
devices.
1.Scrub the devices in the host that with same iqns and luns of target;
2.Scrub /dev/sd* which belong to multipath device but not in
/dev/disk/by_path;
3.Scrub multipath devices shell.

Change-Id: I90d095509edbe0ede0d63543026538f8aedf46d6
Closes-Bug: #1553730

subject: Configure nofile OS limit for memcached server role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-20 14:29:07.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/memcached_server/tasks/memcached_config.yml', 'playbooks/roles/memcached_server/defaults/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/memcached_server-add-nofile-setting-504e0c50e10a4ea6.yaml'], 'message': 'Configure nofile OS limit for memcached server role

This fix adds a new override `memcached_connections` which is
automatically calculated from the number of memcached
connection limit plus additional 1k to configure the OS nofile limit.
Without proper nofile limit configuration, memcached will crash
in order to support higher parallel connection TCP/Memcache counts.

Related-To: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317030/

Change-Id: Ib9a3a5fdf567e6024819ebcfd574a5d1d15e5e23
Closes-Bug: #1582288
'}]
commit_message:
Configure nofile OS limit for memcached server role

This fix adds a new override `memcached_connections` which is
automatically calculated from the number of memcached
connection limit plus additional 1k to configure the OS nofile limit.
Without proper nofile limit configuration, memcached will crash
in order to support higher parallel connection TCP/Memcache counts.

Related-To: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317030/

Change-Id: Ib9a3a5fdf567e6024819ebcfd574a5d1d15e5e23
Closes-Bug: #1582288

commit_message:
Fix the issue that delete actions are unclickable

In detail page like volume, image and so on, delete action
is not clickable. Delete actions are set by the code below.
https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.forms.js#L366
However, because of the change below, these no longer match this selector.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/284421/18
This patch will fix it so as to match the selector above.

Change-Id: Ia4ef05b8811c09dedeeb4c3349e989c4e3af5122
Closes-Bug: #1580975

commit_message:
Change to using ANSIBLE_FORKS and update related tip

Instead of using a custom 'FORKS' parameter, this patch switches
to using the standard Ansible environment variable 'ANSIBLE_FORKS'.

The patch also updates the documentation related to forks to use
the right parameter and also to give better examples.

Change-Id: I7fcf152ee945c17bd8c9f6d4ff111805e9e2d0b8

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-20 09:24:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/api_common.py', 'neutron/api/v2/resource.py', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/hooks/translation.py', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/hooks/policy_enforcement.py'], 'message': "Make exception translation common and add to pecan

This moves the exception translation logic from the
legacy api.v2.resource module to a common module and
re-uses it from pecan to bring consistency to the
way language and exception translation is handled
between the two.

This also adjusts the policy enforcement hook to correctly
handle the unsupported method case since 'after' hooks
are executed after 'on_error' hooks that return an exception.

Closes-Bug: #1583844
Change-Id: If3c2d8c94ca6c1615f3b909accf0f718e320d1c2
"}]
commit_message:
Make exception translation common and add to pecan

This moves the exception translation logic from the
legacy api.v2.resource module to a common module and
re-uses it from pecan to bring consistency to the
way language and exception translation is handled
between the two.

This also adjusts the policy enforcement hook to correctly
handle the unsupported method case since 'after' hooks
are executed after 'on_error' hooks that return an exception.

Closes-Bug: #1583844
Change-Id: If3c2d8c94ca6c1615f3b909accf0f718e320d1c2

commit_message:
Update role metadata

This role is now supported on Xenial as of
I78c8c3be9d00fc505fabc83de36dfd43b8e85848.
Update the role's metadata to reflect that.

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-17 16:08:55.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/context.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': "Lazy-load context information requiring Keystone calls

When we load a stored context, don't retrieve additional data from keystone
unless and until it is needed. This makes stacks that don't require the
full data more efficient, and may help prevent an inability to contact
keystone at startup blocking the process of resetting stuck stacks.

Change-Id: Ifa8f5f22686a2ee5c30b8cdb42d921163467b64a
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Herve <therve@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1570569
"}]
commit_message:
Lazy-load context information requiring Keystone calls

When we load a stored context, don't retrieve additional data from keystone
unless and until it is needed. This makes stacks that don't require the
full data more efficient, and may help prevent an inability to contact
keystone at startup blocking the process of resetting stuck stacks.

Change-Id: Ifa8f5f22686a2ee5c30b8cdb42d921163467b64a
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Herve <therve@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1570569

commit_message:
Augment release note for import_object_ns removal

Passing a compute_driver via nova.virt.foo worked in the past, and no
longer does after merging 8eb03de1eb83a6cd2d4d41804e1b8253f94e5400. Add
an upgrade note to make sure anyone using this doesn't get burned.

Change-Id: I89e6b669a5ba1232bde88821f40022314ba2541b

subject: Scrub before RebuildSlotMap
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-20 20:18:21.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_slot.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/slot.py'], 'message': "Scrub before RebuildSlotMap

The spawn flow adds scrubbing tasks for the VM being created, to be run
after VIF creation, but before any storage mappings occur.

On a rebuild, VIF plugging needs to generate (and validate) the slot
mappings for the I/O devices being attached to the rebuilding VM. The
process of creating the slot mappings includes ensuring all the
necessary disks are present and available on the target VIOSes. Since
this is happening before the scrubbing, it can fail when stale mappings
still exist for the VM being created.

This change set adds a comprehensive scrub in
NovaSlotManager.init_recreate_map, before the RebuildSlotMap is
initialized, which includes scrubbing all mappings from stale LPARs
*and* the LPAR we're rebuilding.

Change-Id: I87bb279141a2e867f5349ce7e699596420b1c0dc
Closes-Bug: 1583825
"}]
commit_message:
Scrub before RebuildSlotMap

The spawn flow adds scrubbing tasks for the VM being created, to be run
after VIF creation, but before any storage mappings occur.

On a rebuild, VIF plugging needs to generate (and validate) the slot
mappings for the I/O devices being attached to the rebuilding VM. The
process of creating the slot mappings includes ensuring all the
necessary disks are present and available on the target VIOSes. Since
this is happening before the scrubbing, it can fail when stale mappings
still exist for the VM being created.

This change set adds a comprehensive scrub in
NovaSlotManager.init_recreate_map, before the RebuildSlotMap is
initialized, which includes scrubbing all mappings from stale LPARs
*and* the LPAR we're rebuilding.

Change-Id: I87bb279141a2e867f5349ce7e699596420b1c0dc
Closes-Bug: 1583825

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-12 10:40:32.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/os-neutron-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-horizon-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-heat-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-keystone-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-nova-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-ironic-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-cinder-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-glance-install.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/db-create-in-playbooks-6fb8232da53fe1e1.yaml'], 'message': 'Added the DB and DB user create to the plays

All of the database and database user creates have
been removed from the roles into the playbooks. This
allows the roles to be tested independently of the
deployed database and also allows the toles to be
used independently of infrastructure choices made by
the integrated OSA project.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Added the DB and DB user create to the plays

All of the database and database user creates have
been removed from the roles into the playbooks. This
allows the roles to be tested independently of the
deployed database and also allows the toles to be
used independently of infrastructure choices made by
the integrated OSA project.

Change-Id: If58e482034a65c0e50241448dbe298a73c1ae71b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Default to venv isolated tempest on stable liberty
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-03 17:46:50.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': 'Default to venv isolated tempest on stable liberty

Tempest follows global requirements of master on openstack (as it is
branchless) when running tempest in an all in one environment with an
older branch this can cause requirements conflicts. To prevent this
issue we need to venv isolate tempest from the system to ensure that
everything is properly isolated.

Change-Id: I6944b9f5732d21a6b4ceb567dda84d6daaf62e1c
'}]
commit_message:
Default to venv isolated tempest on stable liberty

Tempest follows global requirements of master on openstack (as it is
branchless) when running tempest in an all in one environment with an
older branch this can cause requirements conflicts. To prevent this
issue we need to venv isolate tempest from the system to ensure that
everything is properly isolated.

Change-Id: I6944b9f5732d21a6b4ceb567dda84d6daaf62e1c

subject: Fix config path for running wsgi in developer mode
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 8866, 'name': 'Raildo Mascena de Sousa Filho', 'email': 'rmascena@redhat.com', 'username': 'raildo'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}, {'_account_id': 19985, 'name': 'Ryosuke Mizuno', 'email': 'r-mizuno@rs.jp.nec.com', 'username': 'r-mizuno'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-18 04:42:02.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/server/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Fix config path for running wsgi in developer mode

When following the new developer instructions for running keystone
under uwsgi, keystone could not find the keystone config file under
./etc/. This then caused it to be unable to find the paste config file
that it would have looked for in the same directory, resulting in an
error[1]. This patch adds the same logic that the eventlet server used
to have to add ./etc/keystone.conf to the list of potential config file
locations.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/497439/

Change-Id: Iae02715df3ec28bf537cb8014f829ad52cc54c68
'}]
commit_message:
Fix config path for running wsgi in developer mode

When following the new developer instructions for running keystone
under uwsgi, keystone could not find the keystone config file under
./etc/. This then caused it to be unable to find the paste config file
that it would have looked for in the same directory, resulting in an
error[1]. This patch adds the same logic that the eventlet server used
to have to add ./etc/keystone.conf to the list of potential config file
locations.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/497439/

Change-Id: Iae02715df3ec28bf537cb8014f829ad52cc54c68

commit_message:
use the only method to initialize client

using separate methods will produce a confusion and
issues, like not using endpoint_type during client creation.

Closes-bug: 1564805

As part of the investigation around gate failures related to token
revocations, we need to log the addition, removal and use of

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: LOG revocation mechanism

As part of the investigation around gate failures related to token
revocations, we need to log the addition, removal and use of
revocation events in oder to understand what is going on.

This patch is posted a couple of times so we can catch the failure
quickly. Do not review. This is the approach I found to get the info
without needing to merge this.

Change-Id: I5c75decacde71a1f84db686c4a3da520799fca7b

quickly. Do not review. This is the approach I found to get the info
without needing to merge this.

subject: Merge tag '8.1.0'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-09 19:43:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Merge tag '8.1.0'

This is a null-merge of the 8.1.0 release tag back into the master
branch so that the 8.1.0 tag will appear in the git commit history of
the master branch. It contains no actual changes to the master branch,
regardless of how our code review system's UI represents it. Please
ask in #openstack-infra if you have any questions, and otherwise try

commit_message:
Merge tag '8.1.0'

This is a null-merge of the 8.1.0 release tag back into the master
branch so that the 8.1.0 tag will appear in the git commit history of
the master branch. It contains no actual changes to the master branch,
regardless of how our code review system's UI represents it. Please
ask in #openstack-infra if you have any questions, and otherwise try
to merge this as quickly as possible to avoid later conflicts on the
master branch.

Change-Id: I96490c9b3942363462cbd913dad6b01e2aa99171

commit_message:
resource-providers: generic resource pools

Adds specification for generic resource pools in Nova, which solves the
problem of incorrect capacity and usage information for shared storage
resources.

blueprint: generic-resource-pools
ApiImpact
Change-Id: I129a50c5f3790307a1c7bca4ac97580673cb57da

subject: Updating os_horizon to use the Multi-Distro framework
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-20 19:02:16.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install-apt.yml', 'tasks/main.yml', 'vars/debian.yml', 'tasks/horizon_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'meta/main.yml'], 'message': 'Updating os_horizon to use the Multi-Distro framework

Implements: blueprint multi-platform-host

commit_message:
fullstack: test for snat and floatingip

Fullstack test to test snat and floatingip through legacy router.
This test creates external network and boots a vm with external
network's gateway and connected to central-external-br.
Tenant vm is booted on internal network.
Tenant Router is connected to internal and external networks.

To test SNAT, it pings external vm from tenant vm.
To test floatingip, a new floatingip is assigned to tenant vm
and tests pinging to tenant vm's floatingip from external vm.

Partial-Bug: #1583028
Change-Id: I1f30c240419ec93a26368ed1623bb2ede595e3d1

commit_message:
Add additional translation files for compile_catalog

In cinder translation files are split into cinder, cinder-log-error,
cinder-log-warning and cinder-log-info. With babel version 2.3.4 (current
version in requirements), compile_catalog can pass a comma separated
list of files to be compiled.

Closes-Bug: 1584043

Change-Id: I3d44efe2acf12e406683ec39c14ea385c1577d00

commit_message:
Make reproduce function quiet

In every console log (e.g. [1]) we've got a long section of looping
around variables and writing them out being traced.  This is working
fine, so turn down the tracing on this to give better signal/noise
ratio in logs.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/29/295629/3/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-full/f7fe416/console.html#_2016-03-22_14_53_45_466

Change-Id: Ieac461609a1a1866c1c3c461e75230406dffc649

When Congress re-launchs after persisting policy rules PolicyEngine
needs to load the rules and enable the rules after receiving schema
of datasource service.

commit_message:
Add list users using filters test

This kind of test was missing in the users tests, it is
useful to test the filtering in different backends used
by keystone. For example, the users might be stored in
SQL or LDAP, so the API calls go in different drivers
implementation.

Change-Id: Ia2d9d4ab1a61a88045d25cb6089249268f082d49

subject: Add elastic-recheck data querying
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 5623, 'name': 'David Lyle', 'email': 'dklyle0@gmail.com', 'username': 'david-lyle'}, {'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 7812, 'name': 'Franklin Naval', 'email': 'franklin.naval@gmail.com', 'username': 'fnaval'}, {'_account_id': 9717, 'name': 'Michael Krotscheck', 'email': 'krotscheck@gmail.com', 'username': 'krotscheck'}, {'_account_id': 17001, 'name': 'Tim Buckley', 'email': 'timothy.jas.buckley@hpe.com', 'username': 'timothy.jas.buckley'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-05-20 14:29:23.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_health/tests/test_api.py', 'requirements.txt', 'openstack_health/api.py', 'test/unit/controllers/home_spec.js', 'README.rst', 'app/views/home.html', 'app/js/controllers/home.js', 'app/views/templates/accordion-group-run.html'], 'message': "Add elastic-recheck data querying

This commit is the start of adding support for elastic-recheck data
to openstack-health. This will get the bug numbers for the recent
failed runs it's looking at. To actually use this feature it requires
having elastic-recheck installed and a new api config option for the
location on disk of the query files. This does add some install time
complexity especially as eleastic-recheck is only available via git.
The elastic recheck support is optional and will only be activated if
it is present at import time and the config flag telling the api
server where the queries are located on disk is set.

In order to make the response times reasonable when elastic-recheck
support is enabled dogpile caching is used to keep a cached copy
of the recent results list and limit the amount we're querying
elastic search. By default this is configured to use a dbm file
and refresh the cache every 30mins.

Depends-On: Icf203668690419c38f6d6be6b6fe4af8462845f3
Change-Id: Iccd9ec6d62e2249ec7c09d42ec02ea27c71144cc
"}]
commit_message:
Add elastic-recheck data querying

This commit is the start of adding support for elastic-recheck data
to openstack-health. This will get the bug numbers for the recent
failed runs it's looking at. To actually use this feature it requires
having elastic-recheck installed and a new api config option for the
location on disk of the query files. This does add some install time
complexity especially as eleastic-recheck is only available via git.
The elastic recheck support is optional and will only be activated if
it is present at import time and the config flag telling the api
server where the queries are located on disk is set.

In order to make the response times reasonable when elastic-recheck
support is enabled dogpile caching is used to keep a cached copy
of the recent results list and limit the amount we're querying
elastic search. By default this is configured to use a dbm file
and refresh the cache every 30mins.

Depends-On: Icf203668690419c38f6d6be6b6fe4af8462845f3
Change-Id: Iccd9ec6d62e2249ec7c09d42ec02ea27c71144cc

subject: DOC: Change swift mountpoint to /srv/node
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-16 15:27:34.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install-guide/configure-swift-config.rst', 'etc/openstack_deploy/conf.d/swift.yml.example', 'doc/source/install-guide/configure-swift-devices.rst'], 'message': "DOC: Change swift mountpoint to /srv/node

Background: Install Guide commands use
/srv/node mount point for /etc/fstab updates,
however example configuration settings for swift.yml
use /mnt. A new deployer, or one that doesn't
follow all of the instructions closely may use /mnt
for the configuration settings and /srv/node for
/etc/fstab updates. This results in an
unuseable swift subsystem.

Change: Update install guide docs, and swift.yml.example
to utilize /srv/node as the mount point example,
consistent with the install guide example /etc/fstab
updates.

Closes-Bug: 1582043

Change-Id: Ic64d36c7481fb4fdb6122d8578a0a6cf45e6b978
"}]
commit_message:
DOC: Change swift mountpoint to /srv/node

Background: Install Guide commands use
/srv/node mount point for /etc/fstab updates,
however example configuration settings for swift.yml
use /mnt. A new deployer, or one that doesn't
follow all of the instructions closely may use /mnt
for the configuration settings and /srv/node for
/etc/fstab updates. This results in an
unuseable swift subsystem.

Change: Update install guide docs, and swift.yml.example
to utilize /srv/node as the mount point example,
consistent with the install guide example /etc/fstab
updates.

Closes-Bug: 1582043

Change-Id: Ic64d36c7481fb4fdb6122d8578a0a6cf45e6b978

commit_message:
Various fixes to the proxy default conf and doc

Default configuration:
 * Include internal and external VIPs in no_proxy_env
 * Set lower case environment variables as well, as some programs may
   not understand the upper case ones

Documentation:
 * Explain the no_proxy environment variable
 * Added the no_proxy environment variable in the example
 * Removed pip_install_options: "--proxy [...]" from the example as it
   is not needed when using environment variables

Change-Id: Iae8b320b27525ec2592687fee42c3d605d36d093

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-18 05:39:30.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/tests/test_cfg.py', 'oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'message': "Disallow config option name as same as attribute of ConfigOpts

If user use config option name(in 'DEFAULT' group) is same with
ConfigOpts's internal attribute like 'project', CONF.project
returns attribute value instead of option value without any error.
That means internal attribute override user's config option in
'DEFAULT' group. The attribute list is: project, prog, version,
usage, and default_config_files. This commit disallows illegal
name in 'DEFAULT' group before registering it.

Closes-Bug: #1550859

Change-Id: I5531092d4899e565176ed3a31821decb35ddfdc9
"}]
commit_message:
Disallow config option name as same as attribute of ConfigOpts

If user use config option name(in 'DEFAULT' group) is same with
ConfigOpts's internal attribute like 'project', CONF.project
returns attribute value instead of option value without any error.
That means internal attribute override user's config option in
'DEFAULT' group. The attribute list is: project, prog, version,
usage, and default_config_files. This commit disallows illegal
name in 'DEFAULT' group before registering it.

Closes-Bug: #1550859

Change-Id: I5531092d4899e565176ed3a31821decb35ddfdc9

commit_message:
NetApp: Use netapp_host_type

This patch deprecates netapp_eseries_host_type in favor of
netapp_host_type. As the default value for netapp_host_type is
set to 'undef', per-driver defaults are picked if no values are
passed to cinder::backend::netapp.

Closes-Bug: #1579161
Change-Id: I4c4dea024dbef08219641569ddec265e473e7b58

subject: Workaround bad required params in troveclient
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-09 10:01:13.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/cloud_config.py'], 'message': "Workaround bad required params in troveclient

troveclient requires username and password as parameters to the Client
object, but if a Session is passed (like we do) that's not needed. A
patch has been submitted to troveclient, but until that has been
released, simply send None to both parameters.

Change-Id: Ie130a4e83cceb7cab69bfbeb559493d195ef35e1
"}]
commit_message:
Workaround bad required params in troveclient

troveclient requires username and password as parameters to the Client
object, but if a Session is passed (like we do) that's not needed. A
patch has been submitted to troveclient, but until that has been
released, simply send None to both parameters.

Change-Id: Ie130a4e83cceb7cab69bfbeb559493d195ef35e1

commit_message:
Reorganize the AMQP 1.0 driver source files

This patch simply moves the existing AMQP 1.0 driver files into a
directory layout that is consistent with the other drivers.  The
driver unit tests are also moved to the proper test directory. There
are no changes in driver functionality or API.

Change-Id: I83a5d5433be8c3b317597100af69192ec5be81f1
Closes-Bug: #1579823
(cherry picked from commit e72a8d5bc4dcbd6542658ea9617ed04ea44673eb)

Add ironic to bvt_2 group test

Ironic is closely related to fuel and should be tested in standart bvt_2

  - it uses fuel-bootstrap to build ironic bootstrap

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-20 13:28:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_slot.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/slot.py'], 'message': "Scrub before RebuildSlotMap

The spawn flow adds scrubbing tasks for the VM being created, to be run
after VIF creation, but before any storage mappings occur.

On a rebuild, VIF plugging needs to generate (and validate) the slot
mappings for the I/O devices being attached to the rebuilding VM. The
process of creating the slot mappings includes ensuring all the
necessary disks are present and available on the target VIOSes. Since
this is happening before the scrubbing, it can fail when stale mappings
still exist for the VM being created.

This change set adds a comprehensive scrub in
NovaSlotManager.init_recreate_map, before the RebuildSlotMap is
initialized, which includes scrubbing all mappings from stale LPARs
*and* the LPAR we're rebuilding.

Change-Id: I87bb279141a2e867f5349ce7e699596420b1c0dc
Closes-Bug: 1583825
"}]
commit_message:
Scrub before RebuildSlotMap

The spawn flow adds scrubbing tasks for the VM being created, to be run
after VIF creation, but before any storage mappings occur.

On a rebuild, VIF plugging needs to generate (and validate) the slot
mappings for the I/O devices being attached to the rebuilding VM. The
process of creating the slot mappings includes ensuring all the
necessary disks are present and available on the target VIOSes. Since
this is happening before the scrubbing, it can fail when stale mappings
still exist for the VM being created.

This change set adds a comprehensive scrub in
NovaSlotManager.init_recreate_map, before the RebuildSlotMap is
initialized, which includes scrubbing all mappings from stale LPARs
*and* the LPAR we're rebuilding.

Change-Id: I87bb279141a2e867f5349ce7e699596420b1c0dc
Closes-Bug: 1583825

This change set will make it so that host initialization waits
for all running VIOSes to get an active RMC state.

We want to do this because evacuated instance cleanup happens
as part of host initialization and if there are VIOSes with
inactive RMC states during this process, mappings from these

commit_message:
Wait for more than just one VIOS on start up

This change set will make it so that host initialization waits
for all running VIOSes to get an active RMC state.

We want to do this because evacuated instance cleanup happens
as part of host initialization and if there are VIOSes with
inactive RMC states during this process, mappings from these
evacuated instances won't be removed. These stale mappings can
cause problems for migration and spawn.

Closes-Bug: #1583245
Change-Id: Ibe60210bb669a53e5fb0d285e7edb552da4df302

commit_message:
Wait for more than just one VIOS on start up

This change set will make it so that host initialization waits
for all running VIOSes to get an active RMC state.

We want to do this because evacuated instance cleanup happens
as part of host initialization and if there are VIOSes with
inactive RMC states during this process, mappings from these
evacuated instances won't be removed. These stale mappings can
cause problems for migration and spawn.

Closes-Bug: #1583245
Change-Id: Ibe60210bb669a53e5fb0d285e7edb552da4df302

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 13562, 'name': 'Samuel Matzek', 'email': 'smatzek@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'smatzek'}, {'_account_id': 14805, 'name': 'Jimmy McCrory', 'email': 'jimmy.mccrory@gmail.com', 'username': 'jimmy-mccrory'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 18784, 'name': 'Michael Carden', 'email': 'mike.carden@gmail.com', 'username': 'mcarden'}, {'_account_id': 20038, 'name': 'Michael Gugino', 'email': 'michael.gugino@walmart.com', 'username': 'michaelgugino'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-05-13 10:44:57.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/ceph_client/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ceph_client/vars/ubuntu-14.04.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ceph_client/vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ceph_client/tasks/ceph_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ceph_client/tasks/ceph_preinstall.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ceph_client/tasks/ceph_all.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/ceph-from-uca-and-distro-2fa04e03c39a61bc.yaml', 'playbooks/roles/ceph_client/tasks/ceph_install_apt.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ceph_client/tasks/ceph_preinstall_apt.yml'], 'message': "Refactor ceph_client for multi-OS and ceph

This patch refactors the ceph_client role to add support for multiple
operating system distros and multiple sources for Ceph packages.

The support of multiple sources for the Ceph packages  is important
to organizations that must get packages from Canonical for service and
support. The current Ceph repo setup goes to upstream ceph.com
repositories and does not work with the UCA.

The use of UCA is also important when running OpenStack on the ppc64le
architecture because ceph.com does not have Debian packages available
for this architecture and the default trusty and trusty-updates repos
only have Ceph Giant, whereas the user can get later releases such as
Ceph Jewel from UCA.

The multiple operating system support for Trusty and Xenial also plays
into this since Xenial has Ceph Jewel by default.  For Xenial OSA
deployments users may want to use the modern ceph client already
available for the distro.

The choice of which Ceph source to use is simple for deployers. They
simply set it with the ceph_pkg_source variable but have additional
variables they can tweak to pick specific Ceph versions from the
sources:

The ceph_pkg_source variable controls the install source for the
Ceph packages.
Valid values include:
  * ceph This option installs Ceph from a ceph.com repo.  Additional
         variables to adjust items such as Ceph release and regional
         download mirror can be found in vars/*.yml

  * uca  This option installs Ceph from the Ubuntu Cloud Archive.
         Additional variables to adjust items such as the
         OpenStack/Ceph release can be found in vars/*.yml.

  * distro This options installs Ceph from the operating system's
           default repository and unlike the other options does not
           attempt to manage package keys or add additional package
           repositories.

Change-Id: Ib21b3f76ccf4556548180c8694786d43fa0a024f
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor ceph_client for multi-OS and ceph

This patch refactors the ceph_client role to add support for multiple
operating system distros and multiple sources for Ceph packages.

The support of multiple sources for the Ceph packages  is important
to organizations that must get packages from Canonical for service and
support. The current Ceph repo setup goes to upstream ceph.com
repositories and does not work with the UCA.

The use of UCA is also important when running OpenStack on the ppc64le
architecture because ceph.com does not have Debian packages available
for this architecture and the default trusty and trusty-updates repos
only have Ceph Giant, whereas the user can get later releases such as
Ceph Jewel from UCA.

The multiple operating system support for Trusty and Xenial also plays
into this since Xenial has Ceph Jewel by default.  For Xenial OSA
deployments users may want to use the modern ceph client already
available for the distro.

The choice of which Ceph source to use is simple for deployers. They
simply set it with the ceph_pkg_source variable but have additional
variables they can tweak to pick specific Ceph versions from the
sources:

The ceph_pkg_source variable controls the install source for the
Ceph packages.
Valid values include:
  * ceph This option installs Ceph from a ceph.com repo.  Additional
         variables to adjust items such as Ceph release and regional
         download mirror can be found in vars/*.yml

  * uca  This option installs Ceph from the Ubuntu Cloud Archive.
         Additional variables to adjust items such as the
         OpenStack/Ceph release can be found in vars/*.yml.

  * distro This options installs Ceph from the operating system's
           default repository and unlike the other options does not
           attempt to manage package keys or add additional package
           repositories.

Change-Id: Ib21b3f76ccf4556548180c8694786d43fa0a024f

commit_message:
Rebase: crt_lu_linked_clone => crt_lu

Recently pypowervm added the ability to create an LU linked clone
directly via crt_lu, and deprecated the crt_lu_linked_clone method.
This change set rebases accordingly.

Change-Id: I7587431e40d9378937b63644f84a4fadb19b717b

subject: acceptance: fix ceph_rgw_civet_spec tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-20 15:08:49.000000000', 'files': ['spec/acceptance/ceph_rgw_civet_spec.rb'], 'message': 'acceptance: fix ceph_rgw_civet_spec tests

In ceph_rgw_civet_spec, we used to deploy fedorapeople repo, which does
not exist anymore, since it moved to centos7.
To unblock the gate, this patch aims to update URLs & GPGkeys so it wil
work again.

Though in the future, we will move all those tests in
puppet-openstack-integration and use common bits that we already have in
place, also deploy current master and not old versions of OpenStack.

Change-Id: I64e69c9048523a8bb3d0852d2d642df677b80ab5
'}]
commit_message:
acceptance: fix ceph_rgw_civet_spec tests

In ceph_rgw_civet_spec, we used to deploy fedorapeople repo, which does
not exist anymore, since it moved to centos7.
To unblock the gate, this patch aims to update URLs & GPGkeys so it wil
work again.

Though in the future, we will move all those tests in
puppet-openstack-integration and use common bits that we already have in
place, also deploy current master and not old versions of OpenStack.

Change-Id: I64e69c9048523a8bb3d0852d2d642df677b80ab5

commit_message:
Update unit tests to use correct method being used

get_active_networks() has no longer been used since havana. This patch
migrates the existing tests calling this method to use the current method
that is being used: get_active_networks_info().

Change-Id: Ibd6871b4884a2694983c4a572e00647674df67ae

Client version pin is maintained in upper-constraints.txt file, so we
should replace it in the file with source based specifier before

commit_message:
Constraint tox targets with upper-constraints.txt

Client version pin is maintained in upper-constraints.txt file, so we
should replace it in the file with source based specifier before
applying it to pip install, otherwise pip fails with:

Could not satisfy constraints for 'python-neutronclient': installation
from path or url cannot be constrained to a version

Change-Id: I33302cdcab980a42c39dc9ec1e430add459615ff
Closes-Bug: #1583050

commit_message:
WIP - DHCP Agent Scheduling API for Segments

Add totally new REST API endpoints to get agents hosting a segment,
get segments hosted by an agent, add a segment to an agent, and
remove a segment from an agent.

Change-Id: Ia8687c9bb3e302a5fffb628429f44fd1fa1dd34c

subject: Tighten the access rules for galera
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-20 14:39:12.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/controller.yaml', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp', 'puppet/controller-post.yaml'], 'message': "Tighten the access rules for galera

Set a password for the 'root' db user and add an additional
'clustercheck' user to be used only by the resource agent.
The password for this 'clustercheck' user is randomly generated
via a heat parameter.

Before this change the workflow to set up the database in the
manifest is the following:
- Step 1 -> Install all the basic galera packages and basic
  configuration
- Step 2.a -> Create /etc/sysconfig/clustercheck with root and empty
  password
- Step 2.b -> Start up galera-monitor xinetd service
- Step 2.c -> Start pacemaker ocf resource (no root user has been
  created
  so there will be an empty password per default)
- Step 2.d -> Wait for /bin/clustercheck to return success and then
  proceed with the other steps

After this change the workflow is slightly more complex because there
is a bit of a chicken and egg problem:
- Step 1 -> Install all the basic galera packages and basic
  configuration
- Step 2.a -> Create /etc/sysconfig/clustercheck with root and empty
  password unless the file does exists already and has a clustercheck
user
  configured
- Step 2.b -> Start up galera-monitor xinetd service
- Step 2.c -> Start pacemaker ocf resource (no root user has been
  created
  yet, so there will be an empty password per default)
- Step 2.d -> Wait for /bin/clustercheck to return success and then
  proceed
  with the other steps
- Step 2.e -> Create clustercheck db user
- Step 3 -> Create /etc/sysconfig/clustercheck with clustercheck user
  credentials
- Step 4.a -> Update the sql root password on the each node (at this
  stage
- Step 4.b -> Create /root/.my.cnf with proper credentials on all nodes

Note that we cannot really create the root/clustercheck users right at
step 1 because the db is not running yet (an approach that spawned
mysqld on each node, created the users and shut it down, was tried but
was much more complex and cannot work on updating existing setups)

Given the new way of solving the root password issue, we also need to
make sure that Step1 and Step2 are running on updates.

Notes:
There was one rebasing conflict because in liberty step 5 does not
exist. So the last operations (sql root password update and
/root/.my.cnf creation) are done at step 4 in order to not create
another step.

Closes-bug: #1581677

Depends-On: I83eed8885503043e881db34411616f9726e00352
(cherry picked from commit e734d752d4f37e93a1637560f9f515320bbe68c5)

Change-Id: Ib447c6e45bb461ac1205355b8b2e8c36c2cc29fa
"}]
commit_message:
Tighten the access rules for galera

Set a password for the 'root' db user and add an additional
'clustercheck' user to be used only by the resource agent.
The password for this 'clustercheck' user is randomly generated
via a heat parameter.

Before this change the workflow to set up the database in the
manifest is the following:
- Step 1 -> Install all the basic galera packages and basic
  configuration
- Step 2.a -> Create /etc/sysconfig/clustercheck with root and empty
  password
- Step 2.b -> Start up galera-monitor xinetd service
- Step 2.c -> Start pacemaker ocf resource (no root user has been
  created
  so there will be an empty password per default)
- Step 2.d -> Wait for /bin/clustercheck to return success and then
  proceed with the other steps

After this change the workflow is slightly more complex because there
is a bit of a chicken and egg problem:
- Step 1 -> Install all the basic galera packages and basic
  configuration
- Step 2.a -> Create /etc/sysconfig/clustercheck with root and empty
  password unless the file does exists already and has a clustercheck
user
  configured
- Step 2.b -> Start up galera-monitor xinetd service
- Step 2.c -> Start pacemaker ocf resource (no root user has been
  created
  yet, so there will be an empty password per default)
- Step 2.d -> Wait for /bin/clustercheck to return success and then
  proceed
  with the other steps
- Step 2.e -> Create clustercheck db user
- Step 3 -> Create /etc/sysconfig/clustercheck with clustercheck user
  credentials
- Step 4.a -> Update the sql root password on the each node (at this
  stage
- Step 4.b -> Create /root/.my.cnf with proper credentials on all nodes

Note that we cannot really create the root/clustercheck users right at
step 1 because the db is not running yet (an approach that spawned
mysqld on each node, created the users and shut it down, was tried but
was much more complex and cannot work on updating existing setups)

Given the new way of solving the root password issue, we also need to
make sure that Step1 and Step2 are running on updates.

Notes:
There was one rebasing conflict because in liberty step 5 does not
exist. So the last operations (sql root password update and
/root/.my.cnf creation) are done at step 4 in order to not create
another step.

Closes-bug: #1581677

Depends-On: I83eed8885503043e881db34411616f9726e00352
(cherry picked from commit e734d752d4f37e93a1637560f9f515320bbe68c5)

Change-Id: Ib447c6e45bb461ac1205355b8b2e8c36c2cc29fa

yum-plugin-priorities needs to be installed before installing any
package, otherwise if we install it after having repos in place, it
becomes useless.

This patch makes sure we install yum-plugin-priorities before any

commit_message:
repo/redhat: install yum-plugin-priorities prior to Yumrepo

yum-plugin-priorities needs to be installed before installing any
package, otherwise if we install it after having repos in place, it
becomes useless.

This patch makes sure we install yum-plugin-priorities before any
Yumrepo resource, so we make sure that Yum priorities will be addressed
correctly.

Change-Id: If99af9b7fd90b1408747a4be874aebeb05dfb2d6

Tighten the access rules for galera

Set a password for the 'root' db user and add an additional
'clustercheck' user to be used only by the resource agent.
The password for this 'clustercheck' user is randomly generated
via a heat parameter.

Before this change the workflow to set up the database in the

- Step 2.a -> Create /etc/sysconfig/clustercheck with root and empty password
- Step 2.b -> Start up galera-monitor xinetd service
- Step 2.c -> Start pacemaker ocf resource (no root user has been created
  so there will be an empty password per default)
- Step 2.d -> Wait for /bin/clustercheck to return success and then

After this change the workflow is slightly more complex because there
is a bit of a chicken and egg problem:
- Step 1 -> Install all the basic galera packages and basic configuration
- Step 2.a -> Create /etc/sysconfig/clustercheck with root and empty
  password unless the file does exists already and has a clustercheck user
  configured
- Step 2.b -> Start up galera-monitor xinetd service
- Step 2.c -> Start pacemaker ocf resource (no root user has been created
  yet, so there will be an empty password per default)

  with the other steps

- Step 5.a -> Update the sql root password on the each node (at this

Note that we cannot really create the root/clustercheck users right at

mysqld on each node, created the users and shut it down, was tried but

Given the new way of solving the root password issue, we also need to

subject: Fix wheel-build.sh for Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-20 13:46:26.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/wheel-build.sh'], 'message': 'Fix wheel-build.sh for Python 3

Replace pip3 command with "python3 -m pip": the pip3 command doesn't exist on
the builder. Moreover, "python -m pip" is now recommended over "pip".

Replace also the pip command with "python -m pip".

Related-Bug: 1582257

commit_message:
Fix wheel-build.sh for Python 3

Replace pip3 command with "python3 -m pip": the pip3 command doesn't exist on
the builder. Moreover, "python -m pip" is now recommended over "pip".

Replace also the pip command with "python -m pip".

Change-Id: Idbc6e53bf2f54a9da952fd940efb8e41e6b7c253
Related-Bug: 1582257

commit_message:
Remove tools/pecan_server.sh

This isn't used anymore and may not even work.
The server runs as part of the previous neutron-server binary
now with an option to control whether pecan or the legacy
code is used.

Change-Id: Ic5236ec305ca21a5e06b3149c7270eb2d62d2606
Closes-Bug: #1579924

commit_message:
HyperV: Add SerialConsoleOps class

This patch introduces a class that will be the entry point for
VM serial console related operations.

This is responsible of setting up serial console handlers for each
instance. This will be used for retrieving the VM console logs as
well as interactive serial console access.

Partially-implements: blueprint hyperv-serial-ports

Change-Id: I40a39e808a63063d37eca8c7fec484d0089987de

[{'number': 28, 'created': '2016-04-18 17:32:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/serialconsolehandler.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_serialconsolehandler.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/constants.py'], 'message': "HyperV: Add serial console handler class

This patch introduces a serial console handler responsible of
spawning/stopping named pipe handlers as well as the serial console
proxy.

Hyper-V VMs have two serial ports (COM1 and COM2). The deployer
will be able to designate serial ports for logging and interactive
sessions using Glance image properties.

The named pipe paths will have suffixes such as 'ro' or 'rw' in
order to designate the above mentioned roles.

Partially-implements: blueprint hyperv-serial-ports

Change-Id: I5db3d60b4d26fbcae9c26557e2179e190de3d37d
"}]
commit_message:
HyperV: Add serial console handler class

This patch introduces a serial console handler responsible of
spawning/stopping named pipe handlers as well as the serial console
proxy.

Hyper-V VMs have two serial ports (COM1 and COM2). The deployer
will be able to designate serial ports for logging and interactive
sessions using Glance image properties.

The named pipe paths will have suffixes such as 'ro' or 'rw' in
order to designate the above mentioned roles.

Partially-implements: blueprint hyperv-serial-ports

Change-Id: I5db3d60b4d26fbcae9c26557e2179e190de3d37d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-27 15:35:35.000000000', 'files': ['monascaclient/v2_0/shell.py'], 'message': 'Alarm def update/patch failed with empty param

Python monascaclient - alarm-definition-update and patch fails if
the orignial alarm-definition has match_by, ok_actions, undetermined_actions
or alarm_actions as null. With the fix, alarm-definition can be updated with
match_by equals "" or '' or [].

Change-Id: I7726212a96c539fda525621ee0297f05e1467da4
'}]
commit_message:
Alarm def update/patch failed with empty param

Python monascaclient - alarm-definition-update and patch fails if
the orignial alarm-definition has match_by, ok_actions, undetermined_actions
or alarm_actions as null. With the fix, alarm-definition can be updated with
match_by equals "" or '' or [].

Change-Id: I7726212a96c539fda525621ee0297f05e1467da4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-29 17:24:42.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh', 'devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': "Start using CINDER_VOLUME_CLEAR to replace CINDER_SECURE_DELETE

CINDER_SECURE_DELETE was deprecated in devstack in liberty with
dfcc3871c022516330b6afb6c74751ac42a87480.

Start using CINDER_VOLUME_CLEAR (default to 'none' to avoid the same bug
that CINDER_SECURE_DELETE is used for).

Add a TODO about removing DEVSTACK_CINDER_SECURE_DELETE once kilo-eol
happens in devstack.

Change-Id: I131c1aee665d6bd4e38dcfd0aec1b4796adc64c5
"}]
commit_message:
Start using CINDER_VOLUME_CLEAR to replace CINDER_SECURE_DELETE

CINDER_SECURE_DELETE was deprecated in devstack in liberty with
dfcc3871c022516330b6afb6c74751ac42a87480.

Start using CINDER_VOLUME_CLEAR (default to 'none' to avoid the same bug
that CINDER_SECURE_DELETE is used for).

Add a TODO about removing DEVSTACK_CINDER_SECURE_DELETE once kilo-eol
happens in devstack.

Change-Id: I131c1aee665d6bd4e38dcfd0aec1b4796adc64c5

commit_message:
Update the api-ref documentation for Root and Nodes

This updates the API root documentation, which was non-existent,
and the Node documentation significantly, replacing many of the samples
and adding more verbiage to each property.

It's not perfect, but this is vastly more correct than the current docs.

Change-Id: Iaeb1c80ac0655fc0d73fa495ed43e3c02b345495

commit_message:
Add unit tests for common Kafka module

Add tests for kafka producer and consumer modules. The test coverage
of monasca_common was was 9%. This is improved in this commit.

Show test coverage when running tox. Change the nosetests command to
show test coverage for the whole module.

revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2016-05-18 08:53:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/services/l3_router/test_l3_dvr_router_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/l3_agentschedulers_db.py'], 'message': 'DVR: Moving router from dvr_snat node removes the qrouters

Removing the router from dvr_snat node removes the qrouters
that are servicing the VM and dhcp ports.

If there are still dvr serviceable ports in the dvr_snat node,
and if router remove command is executed to remove the router
association from the dvr_snat agent then only the snat
functionality should be moved to the the different agent
and the router namespaces should be untouched.

This patch checks if there are any dvr serviceable ports for
the dvr router and if exists, it will not send a router_remove
message to the agent, but instead will send an router_update
message to the agent.

Change-Id: I5a3ba329346ab0d5ea7b0296ec64cc8e5fb4056d
Closes-Bug: #1564575
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Moving router from dvr_snat node removes the qrouters

Removing the router from dvr_snat node removes the qrouters
that are servicing the VM and dhcp ports.

If there are still dvr serviceable ports in the dvr_snat node,
and if router remove command is executed to remove the router
association from the dvr_snat agent then only the snat
functionality should be moved to the the different agent
and the router namespaces should be untouched.

This patch checks if there are any dvr serviceable ports for
the dvr router and if exists, it will not send a router_remove
message to the agent, but instead will send an router_update
message to the agent.

Change-Id: I5a3ba329346ab0d5ea7b0296ec64cc8e5fb4056d
Closes-Bug: #1564575

loads it and then removes the temporary file for it.

All non-interactively.

subject: Workaround ansible bug of copy delegate_to inventory_hostname
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-05-20 15:52:50.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/lxc_cache_preparation.yml'], 'message': "Workaround ansible bug of copy delegate_to inventory_hostname

Ansible Bug: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/15929

When ansible 1.9 copy with delegate_to inventory_hostname, the check
for the presence of the source file to copy (the one delegated to
the remote node) is done on the deploy node.
This works fine when the files exist on the deploy node, but will fail
when the deploy node is different than remote node.

This rollbacks the ansible copy task to a command task to fix
the issue we're hitting.

Change-Id: I893e62003bb7bcf8cdc5e6f766b2b67842090a7f
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
"}]
commit_message:
Workaround ansible bug of copy delegate_to inventory_hostname

Ansible Bug: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/15929

When ansible 1.9 copy with delegate_to inventory_hostname, the check
for the presence of the source file to copy (the one delegated to
the remote node) is done on the deploy node.
This works fine when the files exist on the deploy node, but will fail
when the deploy node is different than remote node.

This rollbacks the ansible copy task to a command task to fix
the issue we're hitting.

Change-Id: I893e62003bb7bcf8cdc5e6f766b2b67842090a7f
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
Ensure that PK values don't default to NULL

MySQL 5.7 is stricter by default; ensure that the primary key
of cisco_csr_identifier_map does not end up with NULL default
otherwise the migration step will fail with:

 'All parts of a PRIMARY KEY must be NOT NULL; if you need NULL in a key, use UNIQUE instead'

Behavioural change introduced in 5.7.3:

 http://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/5.7/en/news-5-7-3.html

Change-Id: Iad2033bec39d223556c2605e3ba3f3dab44223a1
Closes-Bug: #1567899
(cherry picked from commit 3aeae7a3e5a351577002237663ed08ac908d5b45)

commit_message:
Don't enable Q_USE_DEBUG_COMMAND

Test commits I7b11e6264bebeae3665ed195539e10e837ced1d8
I1b532f6e071c5ead0fc5e3ad1aaf364577f4d0ee and
Ia351dc137f28d8ce799d33dbd4c3a7564ed0bdf5 show that
the gate no longer uses neutron-debug for any tests.
So, let's simplify the configuration and not allocate
unused ports/addresses.

Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
fix details filter for measures report

details param is always a string when provided as a param. we can
not turn off detailed filtering. this ensures it's handled as a
boolean

Change-Id: Ie50db5fce99dda2fe2f81beab4f4b7bbbeae5a40

commit_message:
Refresh of Agent plugin documentation

This change includes the following updates
* Re-organized structure to three main sections
* Brought System Metrics up to date
* Added section for Detection Plugins
* Alphabetized list of included Agent plugins
* Included missing plugins (mostly pointing to conf.d examples)
* Split out Libvirt docs into a separate section
* Added ping check detail to Libvirt docs

Change-Id: I309508912f238a4ee2e30424cdf49897f12ab396

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-17 15:59:07.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/swift_ring_builder.rb'], 'message': 'Swift-ring-builder skip line 'Ring up-to-date..'

If a ring is balanced or does not need an update, swift-ring-builder
will print an additional line:
"Ring file /etc/swift/container.ring.gz is up-to-date"
Skip this line in parsing the output to avoid "Warning: Unexpected line:"

Change-Id: Ibc021f62f699c94f36c76b11acefe1000f6a2288
'}]
commit_message:
Swift-ring-builder skip line 'Ring up-to-date..'

If a ring is balanced or does not need an update, swift-ring-builder
will print an additional line:
"Ring file /etc/swift/container.ring.gz is up-to-date"
Skip this line in parsing the output to avoid "Warning: Unexpected line:"

Change-Id: Ibc021f62f699c94f36c76b11acefe1000f6a2288

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-19 18:26:41.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Constraint tox targets with upper-constraints.txt

Client version pin is maintained in upper-constraints.txt file, so we
should replace it in the file with source based specifier before
applying it to pip install, otherwise pip fails with installation can
not be constrained to a version error. Borrowed this solution from
neutronclient project.

Change-Id: Ie3bfab63e092309074a4980831244d90dcb9c7f5
'}]
commit_message:
Constraint tox targets with upper-constraints.txt

Client version pin is maintained in upper-constraints.txt file, so we
should replace it in the file with source based specifier before
applying it to pip install, otherwise pip fails with installation can
not be constrained to a version error. Borrowed this solution from
neutronclient project.

Change-Id: Ie3bfab63e092309074a4980831244d90dcb9c7f5

subject: Security fuzz tests for Secrets
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-03 21:38:17.000000000', 'files': ['functionaltests/api/v1/behaviors/secret_behaviors.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_secrets.py'], 'message': 'Security fuzz tests for Secrets

These tests will attempt various CRUD operations, and attempt to inject
different kinds of "fuzz strings" into the requests to try to get
unexpected results. Currently, most API methods will be tested for the
following issues:

- Remote code execution (RCE)
- SQL injection (SQLi)
- DoS/500 errors via various junk payloads (conversion errors, etc.)

We will add tests for second-order cross-site scripting attacks and
more in the future.

Change-Id: I6e53ae75516d833154f7d29d82ecc9650ed75bb8
Related-Bug: #1481012
Related-Bug: #1481021
Related-Bug: #1481090
'}]
commit_message:
Security fuzz tests for Secrets

These tests will attempt various CRUD operations, and attempt to inject
different kinds of "fuzz strings" into the requests to try to get
unexpected results. Currently, most API methods will be tested for the
following issues:

- Remote code execution (RCE)
- SQL injection (SQLi)
- DoS/500 errors via various junk payloads (conversion errors, etc.)

We will add tests for second-order cross-site scripting attacks and
more in the future.

Change-Id: I6e53ae75516d833154f7d29d82ecc9650ed75bb8
Related-Bug: #1481012
Related-Bug: #1481021
Related-Bug: #1481090

commit_message:
Security fuzz tests for Containers

These tests will attempt various CRUD operations, and attempt to inject
different kinds of "fuzz strings" into the requests to try to get
unexpected results. Currently, most API methods will be tested for the
following issues:

- Remote code execution (RCE)
- SQL injection (SQLi)
- DoS/500 errors via various junk payloads (conversion errors, etc.)

We will add tests for second-order cross-site scripting attacks and
more in the future.

Change-Id: I068aaa96444aa8f31e3bb4ec11b34546c78a3e04
Related-Bug: #1481012
Related-Bug: #1481021

commit_message:
Fixes location of undercloud images

The images hosted at http://artifcats.foo are not available.
Updated the url to the centos CDN. It's not 100% clear if
this is a planned or unplanned outtage at this momemnt.
This change and 318406 will resolve the issue for
quickstart users.

Depends-On: I738c260b5eb660dbfd6de6027bcbd9b2cef7107d
Change-Id: I152717fbc2d3beb6936468f6eb4724b89bcd0edd

revisions:

Change-Id: Iabf061d41a49c427642002254cbfa8f115d2d62a
'}]
commit_message:
Use internal endpoints to communicate

Configure ceilometer to use internalURL endpoints when communicating
with other OpenStack services.

This differs from the default of publicURL to avoid potential issues
with SSL termination on public endpoints.

Change-Id: Iabf061d41a49c427642002254cbfa8f115d2d62a
